content:
さしもつれ〔差縺〕
〈名〉
1. (=もつれ)tangle; entanglement
2. (=紛紜{ふんうん}、葛藤)complication; troubles; an imbroglio

content.content: 人生のさしもつれ
the ravelled skein of life

さしもの〔指物〕
〈名〉Joinery; cabinet-work:(=する) to make (a cabinet, etc.)

さしものし〔指物師〕
〈名〉A joiner; a cabinet-maker

ざしゅ〔座主〕
〈名〉The proprietor of a theatre

content:
さしゅする〔詐取する〕
〈他動〉To defraud (one of anything); to swindle (money from a man―a man out of his money); to cheat (a man out of his money)

content.content: 人の財産を詐取する
to defraud a person of his property
金銭を詐取する
to obtain money by fraud―swindle money from a man―swindle a man out of his money―cheat a man out of his money

さしゅする〔又手する〕
〈自動〉To fold one's arms

content:
さしょう〔些少〕
〈形〉Trifling; slight

content.content: 些少ながら進呈します
Please accept a trifling present―Here is a trifle for you.
些少ですがお礼の印までにさし上げます
I beg to offer it as a slight token of my gratitude.

content:
さしょう〔査証〕
〈名〉Vis?:(=する) to vis?

content.content: 旅行券の査証を受ける
to have one's passport vis?d

content:
さしょう〔詐称〕
〈名〉False assumption; personation:(=する) to assume (a person's name); to personate (a man)

content.content: 姓名を詐称する
to assume a false name
氏名詐称の廉をもって禁錮に処せられた
He was sentenced to imprisonment for assuming another's name.
官名を詐称する
to assume an official title
官史と詐称して金を取った
He obtained money by personating an official.

ざしょう〔座礁〕
〈名〉Running on a rock:(=する) to run on a rock:(欄岸の意味に用いれば)to run aground; to go ashore; to strand

ざしょう〔挫傷〕
〈名〉A sprain; a strain; a wrench:(=する) to sprain, wrench (one's ankle); to strain, wrench (one's shoulder)

content:
ざじょう〔坐乗〕
〈名〉Being on board:(=する) to be on board (a ship)

content.content: 東郷大将坐乗の三笠
the Mikasa with Adm. Togo on board―the Mikasa flying the flag of Adm. Togo

ざじょうろん〔座上論〕
〈名〉An academic discussion; a mere theory

content:
ざしょく〔坐職〕
〈名〉A sedentary occupation

content.content: 坐職者
a sedentary

content:
ざしょく〔坐食〕
〈名〉Eating the bread of idleness:(=する) to eat the bread of idleness; to vegetate

content.content: 人はいくら金持ちでも坐食するものでない
However rich a man may be, he should not eat the bread of idleness.
坐食者
an idler―a drone

content:
さしわたし〔差渡し〕
〈名〉The diameter; the distance across:(副詞に用いれば)in diameter; across; in a straight line; in a bee-line; as the crow flies

content.content: 湖水は差し渡しいくらあるか
What is the diameter of the lake?―How large across is the lake?
差し渡し三里ある
It is three ri in diameter―It is three ri across―The distance across is three ri.
京都から大阪まで差し渡し十里ある
It is ten ri from Kyoto to Osaka in a straight line―in a bee-line―as the crow flies.

content:
さす〔差す〕
〈他動〉
1.

content.content: 傘を差す
to put up an umbrella
傘を差せ
Put up your umbrella―Open your umbrella.
彼は傘を差している
He has an umbrella up.
傘を差して歩く
to walk with an umbrella up
婦人は日傘を差している
She has a parasol up.
彼は雨降りに傘も差さずに歩く
He walks in the rain without an umbrella.
将棋を差す
to play chess
将棋を一番差す
to have a game at chess
一番差そうか
Will you have a game?
駒を差す
to move a man
その手を差そうとは思わなかった
I did not expect that move.
ヤカンに水を差す
to pour water into the kettle―put more water in the kettle
二人の間に水を差す者がある
Somebody is making mischief between us―trying to estrange the two friends―trying to alienate father and son―poisoning her mind against you―brewing ill blood between the two houses.
ランプに油を差す
to feed a lamp with oil―fill a lamp―refill a lamp
時計に油を差す
to oil a watch
機械に油を差す
to oil a machine―grease machinery―lubricate an engine
目に薬を差す
to drop eye-water into the eye
反物を差す
to measure cloth
反物を差してみると丈が無い
On measuring the cloth, it is found to be short measure.
盃を差す
to pass one a cup―offer one a cup
さされた盃飲まぬは卑怯
It is unmanly not to accept the cup offered to one.
紅を差す
to rouge
唇に紅を差す
to rouge the lip
顔に紅を差す
to rouge the face
刀を差す
to wear a sword―(は常に差す、取って差せば)―gird on a sword
武士は二本差したものだ
The samurai used to wear two swords.
棹を差す
to pole a boat
棹を差して河を渡る
to pole a boat across a river
棹を差して舟を出す
to push off
黐{もち}で鳥を差す
to catch a bird with lime
雀を差す
to catch a sparrow with a lime-stick
木が枝を差す
A tree shoots out branches.
潮が差す
The tide flows―The tide sets in.
潮が差している
The tide is flowing―on the flow.
潮が差した
It is high tide―It is high water.
熱が差す
The fever rises.
井戸へ水が差した
The water has risen in the well.
枝が差す
Branches shoot out.
木に枝が差す
A tree shoots out its branches―A tree branches out.
赤味が差す
to become tinged with red
彼女の頬に赤味が差した
Blood mantled her cheeks.
顔に紅が差した
A blush mantled her face.
茜{あかね}差す日の本の国
The Land of the Rising Sun.
魔がさす
to be possessed with a devil―be tempted by the devil―come under some evil influence
あんな男に惚れたのは魔がさしたに違いない
She must have fallen in love with such a man under some evil influence.
魔がさしてあんなばかをしたのだ
The devil tempted me into committing such a folly―I was tempted to commit such a folly.

content:
さす〔刺す〕
〈他動〉
1. To pierce; to prick; to stick; to thrust; to stab; to run

content.content: チクリと刺す
to prick
針で刺す
to prick with a needle
指に針を刺した
I have pricked my finger with a needle.
布に針を刺す
to stick a needle into cloth―stick cloth with a needle
手に棘を刺した
I have run a thorn into my finger.
足に釘を刺した
I have run a nail into my foot.
短刀で刺す
to stab one with a dagger
柄まで通れと短刀を刺す
to thrust a dagger home
剣で刺す
to run one through (with a sword)
剣で刺されて倒れた
He was run through and fell.
銃剣で刺す
to thrust one through with a bayonet
銃剣で刺されて倒れた
He was bayonetted and fell.
魚を串に刺す
to skewer a fish
魚を串に刺して焼く
to broil a fish on a skewer
とどめを刺す
to give one the finishing blow―give one the coup de grace
秋は紅葉にとどめを刺す
The maples are the crowning glory of autumn.
色は年増にとどめを刺す
There is nothing like a young woman for sexual enjoyment.
刺すような痛み
shooting pain
肌を刺すような寒さ
biting cold
肌を刺すような風
a cutting wind
胸を刺すような悪口
cutting remarks―biting sarcasm
彼女は胸を刺すような目付きをした
Her look spoke daggers.
胸を刺すような目で僕をにらんだ
She looked daggers at me.
黐{もち}で鳥を刺す
to catch a bird with lime
雀を刺す
to catch a sparrow with a lime-stick

content: 4. ［野球］To catch (a runner); to put out (a player)

content.content: 走者を刺す
to catch a base-runner
二塁で刺された
I was put out at the second base.

content: 5. (=縫う) to sew; to quilt

content.content: 雑巾を刺す
to quilt a house-cloth
刺子を刺す
to quilt a gown
畳を刺す
to sew a mat

content:
さす〔指す〕
〈他動〉
1. To point (to a thing―at a man); to point out; to indicate

content.content: 先生が地図を指して生徒に問う
The teacher points to the map, and asks the students.
磁石は北を指す
The magnetic needle points to the north.
人に指を指す(笑う)
to point (one's finger) at a man
世人はあの人に後指を指す
People point at him.
人に指を指されぬようにせよ
See that people do not point at you.
人の妻たる者は指を一本指されてもならぬ
Caesar's wife should be above suspicion.
人の妻には指一本指すな
You should not look at a man's wife.
(十目の見るところ)十指の指すところ
Everything points to his guilt―Everybody points to him as the culprit.
図星を指す
to spot one's design
図星を指されて白状した
He had his design spotted, and confessed everything.(どこを)指して(行く)→『さして〔指して〕』
名を指す
to name a person―designate a person―nominate a person―mention one's name―mention one by name
彼は名を指しては言わぬ
He mentions no names.
名は指さないがさる人がそう言った
A certain person whom I will not name―who shall be nameless―said so.
名を指して人を呼ぶ
to call a man by name―want a man by name
暗に指して言う
to allude to anything
この詩人は暗に日本を指しているのだ
The poet alludes to Japan.
君は誰を指して言うのか(誰のことを言うのか)
Whom do you allude to?―Whom do you mean?
別に誰を指して言うのではない学生一般のことを言うのだ
I do not mean any one in particular. I speak of students in general.

content: 4. (=指物する)to make (a table, a chair, etc.)

content.content: 箪笥を指す
to make a cabinet

content:
さす〔射す〕
〈他動〉To shine (on a surface―into a room); to fall (on a surface); to strike (a surface―against the wall)

content.content: 光線が表面にさす
Light shines on a surface―falls on a surface―strikes a surface―strikes against the wall.
障子に月がさす
The moon shines on the paper-screen.
この室は西口が射す
The western sun shines into the room―The room is exposed to the western sun.
室は西向きで夕日がさす
The room looks toward the west, and is exposed to the evening sun.
後光がさす
to be transfigured―glorified
障子に影が射す
A shadow falls on the paper-screen.
月が上って障子に影がさす
The moon throws a shadow on the paper-screen.
噂すれば影がさす
“Talk of the devil, and he will appear.”

content:
さす〔挿す〕
〈他動〉To insert; to thrust; to stick; to plant; to put in

content.content: 穴に棒を挿す
to insert a rod in a hole―thrust a rod into a hole
花瓶に花を挿す
to put flowers in a vase
もとは銭を緡{さし}に挿したものだ
They used to thread cash on a straw-string.
魚を串に挿す
to skewer a fish
魚を串に挿して焼く
to broil a fish on a skewer
簪{かんざし}を挿す
to wear a hair-pin―(は常に挿す、取って挿すなら)―stick a pin in one's hair
枝を挿す
to plant a cutting―put in a cutting
挿した柳が付いた
The willow-cutting has taken root.

content:
さす〔蟄す〕
〈他動〉To sting; to bite

content.content: 蜂がさす
A bee stings―A wasp stings.
蜂にさされた
I was stung by a wasp.
蜂を取ろうとしてさされた
I tried to catch a bee, and got stung.
じっとして居ると蜂はささない
It you keep still, the bees will not sting you.
蚊がさす、蚤がさす
Mosquitoes bite―Fleas bite.
蚊にさされた、蚤にさされた
I was bitten by mosquitoes―bitten by fleas.
虫にでもさされたのだろう
It must be the sting of an insect.
虫にさされてはれた
The sting of an insect has swollen.

content:
ざす〔坐洲〕
〈名〉Stranding:(=する) to strand, be stranded; to run aground; to go ashore

content.content: 船が坐洲している
The ship is stranded―aground―ashore.

ざす〔座主〕
〈名〉The abbot (of a Buddhist temple)

ざすい〔坐睡〕
〈名〉A nap; a doze:(=する) to take a nap; to fall into a doze

content:
さすが〔流石〕
〈副〉
1. (=は) (=何々だけのことがある)(that is) worthy of (him); (that is) characteristic of (him); (it is) just like (him to do so)

content.content: さすがは親父の息子だ
The son is worthy of the father.
さすがは武士だ
His conduct is worthy of a samurai.
危険に臨んてあわてないところはさすがは軍人だ
His presence of mind in danger is worthy of a soldier.
大様なところはさすがは金持ちの坊ちゃんだ
His generosity is worthy of a rich man's son―It is just like a rich man's son to be so generous.
義の為に生命を軽んずるところはさすがは日本人だ
It is just like a Japanese―characteristic of a Japanese―to hold his life at nothing as compared with his cause.
さすがは慣れたもんだ
That's worthy of an old hand.
さすが日本一の名所だけある
The first beauty spot of Japan is worthy of its name―The first beauty spot of Japan does not belie its name.
さすがは大都会だ、何かしら仕事がある
It is worthy of a great city that one always finds something or other to do.
そういうのはさすがは先生だ
The remark is characteristic of the man―It is just like him to say so.
さすがは君だ
That is worthy of you―It is just like you to do so―There I recognize you, Mr. xxx.
さすがは我が子だ
That's worthy of my boy―It is just like my boy to do so.
さすがは佐久間象山の高弟と言われただけある
He is worthy of being called the aptest pupil of Sakuma Shozan―He justifies his name as the aptest pupil of Sakuma Shozan.

content: 2. (=は) (=何々だけあって)like the (great man) that one is; as might be expected of (a great man)

content.content: さすがは武士だけあって危険に臨んでもあわてなかった
Like the samurai that he was,―As might have been expected of a samurai,―he did not lose his presence of mind in presence of danger.
さすがは江戸っ子だけあって座談がうまい
Like the Edokko that he is, he is a good talker.
さすがは軍人の妻だけあって夫が戦死しても泣かなかった
Like the soldier's wife that she was, she did not cry overner husband's death.
さすがは大都会だけあって何かしら仕事がある
Like the great city that she is, one always finds something or other to do.
さすがは女の愚に帰り人目無ければなきまろふ
Like the woman that she was, now that she was left to herself, she abandoned herself to a paroxysm of grief.
さすがは商売柄で抜目が無い
His business makes him shrewd.

content: 3. (=の) (=何々ながらも) (such) as (one is); even; the very; oneself

content.content: さすがの武士も泣いた
Samurai as he was, he was overcome.
さすがの勇士も色を失った
Brave warrior as he was, he changed colour in alarm.
さすがの豪傑も泣かざるを得なかった
Great man as he was, he could not refrain from tears.
さすがの判事も吹き出した
Even the grave judge could not keep his countenance―The very judge could not keep his gravity.
さすがの強情な女もわっと泣き出した
Obstinate woman as he was, she burst into a flood of tears.
さすがの頑固老爺もあの時だけはかねての主義を曲げた
Rigid disciplinarian as he is, he for once departed from his principles.
さすがの暴風にもこの家はびくともしなかった
The storm, furious as it was, could not shake this house.
さすがの豪傑も今度は困ったようだね
Even the very great man himself seems to be perplexed for this once.
さすがの君もこれを見たら感服せざるを得まい
The sight of this will convince even such a sceptic as you are.
さすがの僕もちと閉口つかまつった
Even my great self is a little nonplussed.

content: 4. (=に)(=はたして)as one might expect; as might be expected

content.content: 彼はさすがに偉い
He has shown himself a great man, as might have been expected.
さすがに学者だ
He has shown himself a great scholar, as was expected.
彼はさすがに見立てに背かぬわい
He has proved himself worthy of confidence, as I had expected.
さすがに彼の行為は軍人らしい
He has conducted himself like a soldier, as we had expected.

content: 5. (=に、=は)(=感心なものだ)(it) does credit to (him)

content.content: 一見して計略を看破したのはさすがに慧眼だ
It does credit to his discernment that he saw through the design at a glance.
さすがは東京だ、どうかして仕事がある
It does credit to Tokyo that one always finds something or other to do.
さすがは年功だ
It does credit to his experience―Therein lies the value of experience.

content: 6. (=に) (=さはさりながら、とは言うものの)still; however

content.content: 僻村ながらさすが正月は正月だ
Remote village as it is, New Year is still New Year.
さすがにそこまで立ち入って言うことはできなかった
I could not, however, meddle in his affairs so far.
さすがに女の愚に返り人目無ければ泣きまろぶ
Her feminine nature, however, asserted itself, and, when left to herself, she abandoned herself to a paroxysm of grief.
さすがに犯せし罪の恐ろしく仕慣れしことも手に付かず
Filled, how ever, with remorse for his crime, he could not go about his work as usual.

content: 7. (=に)(=思わず知らず)in spite of oneself

content.content: 彼はその報に接した時はさすがに顔色を変えた
When he heard the news, he changed colour in spite of himself.
その高言のおかしさに彼はさすがに微笑を漏らした
Tickled at the lofty strain in which she talked, he smiled in spite of himself.
彼はさすがに恥じて言葉も無かった
He could not help feeling ashamed, and kept silent.

content:
さずかりもの〔授かり物〕
〈名〉A gift; a boon; a blessing; a godsend; a windfall

content.content: この仕事は細民にとっては授かり物だ
The work is a boon to the poor.
子どもは授かり物だ
Children are Heaven's gifts―(ありがたい物の意味なら)―Children are a blessing―Children are so many blessings.
この商売は授かり物だと思っている
I regard my business as a godsend.

content:
さずかる〔授かる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=授けらる)to be blessed with (children); to be endowed with (talents); to be gifted with (rare abilities, etc.)

content.content: 彼は好い子を授かった
He is blessed with good children.
なんという珍しい才能を授かったものだろう
What rare talents he is endowed with!―gifted with!
善い性質を授かる者もあり悪い性質を授かる者もある
Some are blest with good natures, while others are cursed with evil natures.

content: 2. (=教わる)to be taught (something)

content.content: 秘伝を授かる
to be initiated into the mysteries of an art

content:
さずける〔授ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=与える)to confer (a title on one); to bestow (a favour on one); to bless (one with children); to endow (one with talents); to gift (one with rare powers); to vest, invest (one with authority); to grant, accord (one a privilege); to award (one a prize); to deal, send (one happiness or misery)

content.content: 位を授ける
to confer a rank on one
学位を授ける
to confer a degree on one
彼は博士号を授けられた
He had the doctorate conferred on him.
恩恵を授ける
to bestow a favour on one
天は彼に好い子どもを授けた
Heaven has blessed him with good children.
天は彼に稀なる才能を授けた
Nature has endowed him with rare talents―He is gifted with rare powers.
特権を授ける
to grant one a privilege―accord one a privilege
権能を授ける
to vest one with authority―invest one with authority―to do something
一等賞を授ける
to award one the first prize
天は我れに大いなる幸福を授け給えり
Heaven has dealt me great happiness―sent me great happiness.

content: 2. (=売り付ける)to impose, foist, pass, palm off, fob off (anything upon one)

content.content: こんな偽物を授けられた
I had this false article foisted upon me.

content: 3. (=教える)to teach

content.content: 課業を授ける
to give one a lesson
平常の如く業を授く
Lessons will be given as usual.
秘伝を授ける
to initiate one into the mysteries of an art
策を授けてやった
I suggested a plan to him.

さすまた〔刺股〕
〈名〉A kind of pitchfork (used in former times for catching criminals)

content:
さすらい
〈名〉Wandering

content.content: さすらいの身
a wanderer

content:
さすらう
〈自動〉To wander; to rove

content.content: さすらい歩く
to wander about

content:
さする〔擦る〕
〈他動〉To rub; to chafe; to stroke; to shampoo; to massage

content.content: お肩をさすりましょうか
Shall I rub your shoulders?―shampoo your shoulders?
手をさすると温かになる
Chafe your hands, and it will make them warm―Chafing your hands will make them warm.
腕をさすって待つ
to strain at the leash―to be eager for the fray

content:
ざする〔坐する〕
〈自動〉To sit; to sit down; to seat oneself; to be seated

content.content: 坐して食う
to eat the bread of idleness
坐して食えば山も空し
Idleness will consume a mountain of wealth.
針の蓆{むしろ}に坐す心地
to sit on thorns

さすれば
〈副〉If so; if that is the case; in that case; then

content:
ざせき〔座席〕
〈名〉Sitting room; seating capacity; seating accommodation

content.content: 講堂は千人の座席がある
The lecture hall can seat 1,000―The hall is capable of seating 1,000―The hall has a seating capacity of 1,000―The hall has seating accommodation for 1,000.

content:
ざせつ〔挫折〕
〈名〉
1. (=くじけること)break-down; collapse:(=する) to collapse; to break down

content.content: 事業が中途で挫折した
The project collapsed―broke down―half-way.

content: 2. (=勇気の挫けること)discouragement:(=する) to be discouraged (from trying); to be disheartened; to be daunted; to lose heart; to falter

content.content: 彼は一度の失敗に挫折するような人じゃない
He is not the man to be daunted by a single failure.
彼は一度の失敗に挫折して再挙の勇気が無かった
A single failure discouraged him from trying again.
些細な困難に挫折していては何事も為せぬ
If you are disheartened by trifles, you will not accomplish anything in this world.
勢を挫折する
to damp one's spirits―cast a damp over one's spirits
これだけの困難があればどんな勇者の勢でも挫折するに足る
These difficulties are enough to discourage―dishearten―daunt―the bravest heart.
彼はいよいよという時に挫折した
He lost heart―faltered―at the last moment.

content:
させる
〈他動〉(許してさせる)to let (one do anything):(無理にさせる)make (one do anything):(頼んでさせる)to get (one to do something):(米国にては)to have (one do something)

content.content: 子どもにわがままをさせておきます
I let my children have their own way.
彼に謝罪させました
I have made him apologize.
お手紙を出させましょう
I will get some one to post you letter―have some one post your letter―have your letter posted.
この手紙を出させて下さい
Please have this letter posted!
彼にきっと返済させます
I will see that he pays you―I will see that you are paid―I will see you paid.
お前にどうか及第させたいものだが
I wish you would pass.
僕に面会をさせぬ
They would not let me see him―They deny him to me.

content:
させる
〈形〉→『

content.content: さしたる

させん〔左遷〕
〈名〉Reduction; relegation:(=する) to reduce (one to a lower rank); to relegate (one to a distant post)

content:
ざぜん〔座禅〕
〈名〉Religious meditation; umbilical contemplation

content.content: 座禅を組む
to sit in meditation―sit in contemplation

content:
さぞ〔嘸〕
〈副〉How...!; What a...!; I presume; I dare say:(助動詞をもって表せば)must

content.content: さぞご空腹でしょう
You are hungry, I dare say―You must be hungry.
さぞお疲れでしょう
You are tired, I presume―You must be tired.
さぞ壮観でしたろう
What a sight it must have been!
さぞお悦びでしょう
How glad you must be!―I can imagine your joy.
ご両親はさぞお悦びでになるでしょう
How glad your parents will be!
さぞご退屈でしょう
Time must hang heavily on your hands.
金持ちだったらさぞ好かろう
What a blessing it must be to be rich!
さぞお力落しでしょう
You must feel your loss.

content:
さそい〔誘い〕
〈名〉Invitation; temptation; allurement; enticement

content.content: 悪の誘いに逢う
to be tempted to do evil
誘いに陥る
to yield to temptation
誘いに勝つ
to resist temptation
誘いをかける
to sound one's views―feel one's pulse―feel out one's views―throw out a feeler

content:
さそう〔誘う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=招く)to invite

content.content: 猟に誘われた
I was invited to join in a hunt.

content: 2. (=呼びに行く)to call for (one)

content.content: それでは明日誘いに来る
Then I will call for you tomorrow.
あの頃は互いに誘い合って遊びに行ったものだ
Is those days, we used to call for each other to go on pleasure excursions.

content: 3. (=誘導する)to tempt; to seduce; to lure; to allure; to entice

content.content: 人を悪に誘う
to tempt one (to do evil)
悪友が彼を誘い出しに来る
Bad companions come to lure him out―allure him out―entice him out.
その光景は涙を誘う
It is a pathetic scene.
その音楽は睡眠を誘う
It is drowsy music.
無常の風に誘われる
to die
誘う水あらばいなんとぞ思うという風情がある
She seems ready to yield―She has a yielding look.

ざぞう〔坐像〕
〈名〉A sedentary figure; a sitting image

content:
さそく〔早速〕
〈形〉Quick (wit); ready (wit); extemporary (witticism); impromptu (play); improvised (song, etc.)

content.content: 早速の気転
quick wit―ready wit
早速のしゃれ
an extemporary witticism
早速の狂言
an impromptu play
早速の歌
an improvised song
彼は早速がうまい
He is good at improvisation―He is a good improvisator.

content:
さた〔沙汰〕
〈名〉
1. (=官府などの指令)orders

content.content: 御沙汰
an Imperial message
彼には畏きあたりより有難き御沙汰ありしやに承る
A gracious message was sent to him from high places, we understand.
大将には種々有難き御沙汰が有った
Honours were showered upon the general
彼には叙勲の御沙汰が有った
A decoration was conferred upon him.
追って昇級の御沙汰があるだろう
You will be promoted in due course.
彼は特別の御沙汰に依て謁見仰せ付けられた
He was received in audience by special favour.
追って沙汰をするまで品物を売らずにおけ
Hold the goods subject to further instructions.
地獄の沙汰も金次第
“Money opens all doors.”

content: 2. (=知らせ)notice; warning:(=する) to give (one) notice; to give (one) warning; to notify

content.content: 追ってなに分の沙汰をする
You shall hear from me in due course.
追って沙汰をするまで待て
Wait till further notice.
こちらから沙汰をするまで来ることはない
You need not come till I give you notice.
沙汰のあり次第に出発する
I shall depart as soon as I have notice.
何の沙汰も無く視学官に来られた
We had the inspector come without notice―without previous warning.
国の方から何の沙汰も無い
I have not heard from home.
遠からず何とか沙汰があるだろう
I shall hear from him before long.
早速御沙汰があることと思っていました
I expected to hear from you without delay.

content: 3. (=取沙汰、噂)a rumour; a report:(=する) to rumour; to report

content.content: 世間にはいろいろの沙汰がある
Various rumours are current―Various reports are circulated.
そのことからとかくの沙汰になった
The circumstance gave rise to various rumours.
そのことが世間の沙汰になっている
It is the talk of the town.

content: 4. (=事、事件、処置)a thing; an affair; a case; a proceeding

content.content: あれはまじめの沙汰ではない
He can not be in his right mind―in his senses.
この計画はまじめの沙汰とは思われぬ
The scheme can not have originated with a man in his right mind.
狂気の沙汰だ
He must be out of his mind―out of his senses.
これは専横な沙汰だ
This is a high-handed proceeding.
この処置は人外の沙汰だ
The measure is inhuman―an offence against humanity―an outrage on humanity.
腕力沙汰になる
to come to blows―fall to blows
論判から腕力沙汰になった
From words they came to blows―They proceeded from words to blows.
裁判沙汰
a lawsuit―an action at law
間男沙汰
an adultery affair―a case of adultery
盗難沙汰
a case of burglary―a case of robbery
彼の英語は完全どころの沙汰ではない
His English is far from perfect―anything but perfect.
結婚どころの沙汰ではない
I can not think of marrying―Marriage is not to be thought of―out of the question.
(何だと、辞職する)それどころの沙汰ではない
You must not think of doing such a thing―Resignation is not to be thought of―out of the question.
沙汰止みになった
The matter was dropped―The project was abandoned.
僕の洋行は沙汰止みになった
My plan of going abroad has been abandoned.
沙汰の限り
absurd
あんな者を校長にするとは沙汰の限りだ
It is absurd―preposterous―monstrous―outrageous―atrocious―that such a man should be made principal.

さだ〔蹉跎〕
〈名〉
1. (=転ぶこと)falling:(=する) to fall (on the ground)
2. (=時機を逸すること)missing an opportunity:(=する) to miss one's opportunity

さだいじん〔左大臣〕
〈名〉The Minister of the Left, the Senior Minister (of the old regime)

content:
さだか〔定か〕
〈形〉
1. (=確か)certain

content.content: さだかにわからぬ
I can not say for certain―I do not know for a certainty.

content: 2. (=明か)clear

content.content: さだかに見えぬ
I can not see clearly―It is not distinctly visible.

content:
さたなしで〔沙汰無しで〕
〈副〉Without notice; without previous warning

content.content: 沙汰無しで視学官に来られた
We had the inspector come without warning.

content:
さたのかぎり〔沙汰の限り〕
〈形〉Absurd

content.content: あんな者を校長にするとは沙汰の限りだ
It is absurd―preposterous―monstrous―outrageous―atrocious―that such a man should be made principal.

content:
さだまった〔定まった〕
〈形〉Fixed (habitation); regular (occupation); definite (purpose); settled (convictions); set (form); established (custom); prescribed (form); standing (rule); uniform (size); foregone (conclusion); (a matter) of course

content.content: 彼は定まった住処が無い
He has no fixed habitation.
定まった職業が無い
He has no regular occupation.
定まった収入が無い
He has no regular income.
定まった教育を受けたことが無い
He has had no regular education.
定まった目的が無い
He has no definite purpose.
定まった考えが無い
He has no settled convictions.
定まった規則が無い
There is no standing rule―no established rule.
定まった形式がある
There is a set form―an established form―a prescribed form.
机は皆定まった大きさにできている
The desks are all of uniform size.
末は夫婦になるのは定まったことだ
It is an understood thing―a settled affair―a done thing―that the two marry in the end.
この事業が失敗に帰することは始めから定まったことだった
It was a foregone conclusion that the project would end in a failure.
勉強家が成功し怠け者が失敗するのは定まったことだ
It is a matter of course that a diligent man should succeed, and an idle fellow fail.
生ある者が死ぬのは定まったことだ
It is in the course of nature that living things should die.

content:
さだまる〔定まる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=決定される)to be fixed (upon); to be decided (upon); to be set; to be settled; to be arranged; to be appointed; to be regulated

content.content: 日が定まったか
Has the day been fixed (upon)?―been set?
時と場所はまだ定まらぬ
The time and the place are not yet appointed.
平和会議の場所はパリと定まった
Paris was fixed upon as―decided upon as―the seat of the peace conference.
彼が僕の後へ入ることに定まった
It is arranged that he shall succeed to my post.
なにもかも予め定まっている
All is arranged beforehand.
彼が後へ入るように前もってちゃんと定まっていたのだ
It was all arranged beforehand that he should take my place.
彼は考えが定まっている、考えが定まらない
He has settled convictions―no settled convictions.
天気が定まらない
The weather is unsettled.
いつも今時分は天気が定まらない
The weather is always changeful―fickle―at this time of the year.
人の運命はちゃんと定まっているものか
Is a man's destiny irrevocably fixed in Heaven?
彼の運命はもう定まった
His fate is sealed―His doom is sealed.
我が国の運命はこの一戦にて定まる
The fate of the Empire depends on this action.
僕の幸不幸は君の返事で定まる
My happiness depends upon―hinges upon―your answer.
相場は需要供給より定まる
Price is regulated by demand and supply.
人の品性は境遇によって定まる
A man's character is formed by circumstances.
考え(心)が定まった
I have made up my mind―decided―come to a decision.
若いうちは心が定まらない
Young men do not know their own minds.

content: 2. (=鎮定される)to be repressed; to be suppressed; to be subdued; to be quelled; to be restored to peace

content.content: 明治十年西郷隆盛反しいくばくも無くして定まる
In the Tenth Year of Meiji, Saigo Takamori raised a rebellion, which, however, was soon suppressed.
天下定まる
The country is restored to peace.
天下大いに定まる
Peace reigns over the land.

content:
さだめ〔定め〕
〈形〉Prescription; ordinance; decree; establishment; arrangement; agreement; regulation; rule:(=の) prescribed; established; regular; regulation; appointed

content.content: 定めの時間までにできるか
Will it be ready by the appointed time?―the prescribed hour?
定めの賃銭はいくらか
What is the regulation fare?
それが法律の定めだ
It is ordained by law.
僕は間食をせぬ定めにしている
I make it a rule not to eat between meals.
ここではそういう定めになっている
It is the established custom here.
世のなりゆきは神の定めなり
The course of events is God's decree.
世の定め
the decree of Fate―destiny

content:
さだめし〔定めし〕
〈副〉I presume; I dare say:(助動詞をもって表せば)must

content.content: さだめし空腹だろう
He is hungry, I dare say―He must be hungry.
さだめし辛いことだろう
They must have a hard time of it.
さだめしご承知でしょうが
You must be aware that...
さだめし誰からかお聞きになったろうが
Some one must have told you that.
今頃は さだめし後悔しているだろう
He must be repenting of his step by this.

content:
さだめなき〔定め無き〕
〈形〉Uncertain (world); irregular (life); indefinite (purpose); unsettled, changeful, fickle (weather); mutable, unstable, transient, fleeting (life, etc.)

content.content: 定め無き世
an uncertain world―a mutable world
定めなき人生
an unstable existence―a transient life―a fleeting life
定め無き浮世なる哉
How transient is life!
定め無き天候
unsettled weather―changeful weather―fickle weather
彼はどこを目的と定め無く流浪している
He wanders about without any definite purpose.

content:
さだめる〔定める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=決定する)to decide, decide upon (a matter); to fix, fix upon (the day); to determine, determine upon (one's course); to settle, settle upon (anything); to arrange (a matter); to agree upon (the terms); to appoint (the time and place); to set (the day); to name (the sum); to regulate (the fare); to prescribe (the method); to ordain (anything by law); to establish (a rule); to decree (the course of events, etc.)

content.content: 日を定める
to fix (upon) the day―set the day―make a date
(結婚の)日を定めるのは女の役目
It is for the lady to name the day.
時と場所を定めて下さい
Please appoint the time and place.
会合の場所を東京と定めた
Tokyo was fixed upon as―decided upon as―the place of meeting.
品物の値段を定める
to fix the price of an article―set a price on an article
相対で事を定めます
We shall settle the matter between ourselves.
彼を僕の後任に定めた
I have settled upon him as my successor.
彼が僕の後へ入ることに定めた
It is arranged that that he shall take my place.
これを定めるのは君の権内に在る
It rests with you to decide―The decision rests with you.
(売買の)約束を定める
to close a bargain―strike a bargain
金額を判然と定めて下さい
Please name the exact sum.
必要に応じて金額を定める
The amount will be decided upon according to the urgency of the case―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The urgency of the case will determine the amount.
彼を雇うことにはほぼ定めたけれども条件はまだ定めない
I have very nearly decided to engage him, but the terms are not yet agreed upon.
方針を定める
to determine upon one's course
住所を定める
to settle one's abode―take up one's abode
歩調を定める
to set the pace
航路を定める
to lay a course―shape one's course
規則を定める
to establish a rule
方法を定める
to prescribe the method
法律をもって定めてある
It is ordained by law.
賃銭は官庁で定めておく
The fare is regulated by the authorities.
世のなりゆきは天の定むるところ
The course of event; is ordained by Heaven―decreed by Fate.
方向を定める
to set an object before one―propose an object to oneself
度胸を定める
to brace one's nerve―nerve oneself
狙いを定める
to take aim―take a steady aim
お前は身を定めても好い年だ
You are of an age to settle down.
僕は間食をせぬことに定めている
I make it a rule never to eat between meals.

content: 2. (=推定する、断定する)to infer; to conclude; to judge

content.content: 彼の言語挙動から発狂と定めた
From his speech and behaviour, we concluded him to be mad.
人物は容貌をもって定むべからず
A man should not be judged by his appearance―We must not judge of a man by his looks.
余は推して定むべし
The rest may be inferred.

content: 3. (=鎮定する)to repress, suppress, subdue, quell (a rebellion); to restore (the land) to peace

content.content: 乱を定める
to suppress a rebellion―subdue a revolt
天下を定める
to restore the land to peace

content:
さたやみ〔沙汰止み〕
〈名〉Abandonment

content.content: 沙汰止みになった
The project was abandoned―The matter was dropped.
僕の洋行は沙汰止みになった
My plan of going abroad has been abandoned―My going abroad is over.

content:
さたん〔左袒〕
〈名〉Support; advocacy; espousal of a cause:(=する) to support (a party); to advocate (a doctrine); to espouse the cause of (the oppressed); to side with (a party); to take one's side; to take the side of (the oppressed); to take sides with (a power); to take one's part; to take part with (a party); to range oneself on the side of (the Liberals); to cast in one's lot with (the opposition party); to lend oneself to (a crime, etc.)

content.content: 政党に左袒するとうるさい
It is troublesome to side with―take sides with―take part with―cast in one's lot with―a political party.
過激派に左袒する気は無い
I have no intention of espousing the cause of the Bolshevists.
過激主義に左袒はせぬ
I do not advocate Bolshevism.
左袒を求める
to enlist another in one's cause

さたん〔嗟嘆〕
〈名〉
1. (=感嘆)admiration:(=する) to admire
2. (=歎息)lamentation:(=する) to lament

content:
ざだん〔座談〕
〈名〉Conversation; table-talk

content.content: 座談が上手だ
He is a good talker.
座談の才
conversational powers

content:
さち〔幸〕
〈名〉Good fortune; happiness; blessing

content.content: この子に幸あれしと祈る
to bless a child

ざちょう〔座長〕
〈名〉The chairman; the president

content:
さつ〔冊〕
〈名〉(一部)a copy:(一巻)a volume

content.content: この本は何冊になっているか
How many volumes is the book in?
一部三冊の本
The book is in three volumes―It is a book in three volumes.
この本を一冊買おう
I will take a copy of this book.
聖書を一冊くれ
I want a bible.
小説を四五冊買った
I have bought four or five novels.

content:
さつ〔札〕
〈名〉A bank-note; a note; paper-money:(米国にては)a bill; a bank-bill

content.content: 一円札
a one-yen note
十円札
a ten-yen note―a tenner
五円札
a five-yen note―a fiver
金は金貨で上げましょうか札で上げましょうか
Will you have the money in gold or in paper?
お札を並べる
to count out the money―pay down the money
札びらきって遊ぶ
to sport one's fortune

content:
ざつ〔雑〕
〈形〉Rough; rough and ready; rude; coarse

content.content: この絵は雑に画いてある
The picture is roughly drawn.
品物は雑な作りだ
The articles are roughly made―of rough make.
雑な造りの家だ
The house is of rude construction―It is a roughly built house.
雑な頭だ
He has a coarse brain.
雑な人間だ
He is a man of coarse fibre.
雑な言葉を使う
He uses coarse expressions.
雑な英語
rough and ready English

content:
さつい〔殺意〕
〈名〉Murderous intent; a murderous design

content.content: 殺意を起こす
to conceive a murderous design

content:
さつえい〔撮影〕
〈名〉Photographing:(=する) to photograph; to take a photograph of (anything); to snapshot, snapshoot (a man, etc.)

content.content: 彼は汽車に乗り込むところを撮影された
He was snapshot just as he was entering the car.
この地帯内撮影を禁ず
No photographing within this zone.

content:
ざつえき〔雑役〕
〈名〉Miscellaneous services:(軍隊のは)fatigue-duty

content.content: 雑役隊
a fatigue-party
雑役婦
a charwoman―a maid of all work

さっか〔作家〕
〈名〉An author; a writer

さっか〔作歌〕
〈名〉Writing poems; composing songs; verse-making; versification

content:
ざっか〔雑貨〕
〈名〉Miscellaneous goods; general merchandise; grocery

content.content: 雑貨商
a grocer
彼は雑貨商をしている
He is a grocer―in the grocery line.
雑貨店
the grocer's―a grocery
それは雑貨店にある
It is to be had at the grocer's―at the grocery.

content:
さつがい〔殺害〕
〈名〉Murder:(=する) to murder; to kill

content.content: 殺害を企てる
to make an attempt on one's life―have designs on one's life―conspire against one's life―plot one's death
殺害事件
a murder case
殺害者
a murderer

さっかく〔錯覚〕
〈名〉An optical illusion; hallucination

content:
さっかしょう〔擦過傷〕
〈名〉An abrasion; a graze; a scratch

content.content: 擦過傷を負う
to sustain an abrasion―(軽く言えば)―get a scratch

content:
さっかつ〔殺活〕
〈名〉Life or death

content.content: 殺活問題
a life-or-death question―a crucial test
殺活自在
He carries life and death in his hands―carries fire in one hand and water in the other.
雄弁家は(人を泣かすも笑わすも)殺活自在なり
An orator sways the minds of men―carries his audience with him―sweeps his audience along with him.
殺活の権は我が掌中に在り
He is in my power―at my mercy.

content:
ざっかん〔雑感〕
〈名〉Miscellaneous impressions; miscellaneous thoughts

content.content: 欧州大戦雑感(本の表題にすれば)
Reflections on the European War.

content:
さっき〔殺気〕
〈名〉Death; defiance; excitement

content.content: 殺気天に満つ
Death was in the air.
殺気天を衝かんばかり
The excitement was intense.
殺気堂に満つ
Death filled the hall.
議場は殺気に満ちた
The House was tense with excitement.
民衆は殺気を帯びて来た
The populace assumed a defiant attitude.
殺気を放つ
to bid defiance to―hurl defiance at―the enemy
彼らの顔は殺気を含んでいる
Their faces breathe defiance―glow with defiance.
談判委員は殺気を含んでいた
The negotiators had a defiant air―looked death.
殺気立つ
to grow excited
殺気立った会合であった
It was an excited meeting―a clamorous meeting.

content:

content:
さっする〔察する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=推察する)to guess; to conjecture; to surmise; to divine; to judge (from reports); to gather (from one's words, etc.)

content.content: (言葉は通じなかったが)容易に彼の意を察した
I readily guessed his meaning.
いろいろ察してみても彼の意がわからなかった
I vainly guessed at his meaning.
(なるほどと)事実を察した
I divined the truth.
僕の察した通りであった
I was right in my conjectures―It was as I had conjectured.
察した通りでなかった
I was wrong in my conjectures.
君の察する通りだ
You have guessed right―You are right in your conjectures.
君の察した通りでない
You have guessed wrong―You are wrong in your conjectures.
評判から察すると彼は偉い人らしい
Judging from reports, he seems to be great man.
彼はやつれた様子から察するとよほど苦労したらしい
Judging from his haggard appearance, he seems to have gone through much.
この事実から察すると彼は高潔な人物らしい
Judging from this fact, he seems to be a man of high principles.
彼の口振りから察すると真の事情を知らぬらしい
I gather from his words that he is ignorant of the real state of things.
あれこれ綜合して彼の意を察した
Putting this and that together, I gathered his meaning―guessed his meaning.

content: 2. (=察知する)to observe

content.content: 世の形勢を察する
to observe the state of affairs
天下の大勢を察する
to observe the general tendency of the world―grasp the situation
時局の大体を察する
to take a general view of the situation
事実を公平に察しなければならぬ
We must take a just view of the facts.
将来を察する
to look into the future―glance into the future―peer into the future―dip deep into the future
過去を窺い将来を察する
We look into the past and glance into the future.

content: 3. (=想像する)to imagine

content.content: その驚き察すべし
His surprise may be imagined.
その得意察すべし
He is proud of his performance, as may be imagined.
後はよろしく察し給え
You may imagine the rest.

content: 4. (=仮定する)to suppose

content.content: 察するところ君も欲しいのだろう
You would like to have it, too, I suppose?
察するところ彼は金でも借りたいのだろう
He wants to borrow money, I suppose?
さぞお困りでしょう、お察し申す
You must be in great trouble, I suppose―I presume―I dare say.

content: 5. (=思い遺る)to feel for (one); to sympathize with (one); to enter into, consider, consult (one's feelings); to understand (one's situation)

content.content: 人の心(胸中)を察する
to enter into one's feelings―consider one's feelings―consult one's feelings
胸中お察し申す
I feel for you―I sympathize with you.
少しは僕の胸中を察してくれ給え
You might have some consideration for my feelings.
(可哀そうな女だ)その胸中察すべしだ
Her mood must needs be pitied.
二人は互いに胸中を察し合っている
They understand each other.
君の境遇はお察し申す
I understand your situation―appreciate your situation.
御愁傷の程お察し申し上げ候
I sympathize with you in your affliction.

content: 6. (=察せらる、思われる)to have reason to think (believe, etc.)

content.content: この論文を草したのはあの人かと察せられる
I have reason to think―have every reason to think―that he is the author of the article.
どうも他殺のように察せられる
There is every reason to believe that violent hands have been laid upon him.

content:
さっそく〔早速〕
〈副〉
1. At once; directly; straightway; forthwith; quickly; promptly; speedily; incontinently; immediately; instantly; on the instant; on the spot; without delay; without a moment's delay; without loss of time; at a moment's notice; at the earliest date; out of hand; right away; the first thing:(接続詞に用いれば)as soon as:(=の) quick; early; speedy; prompt

content.content: 早速仕事に取りかかりましょう

早速ですが

早速ですが金を少し貸して下さいませんか
Excuse my haste, but will you lend me some money?
早速の御承諾有難く御礼申上候

この病気は早速手当をしないと手後れになる

君がいなくなると早速困る

早速お返事を願います
You will give me an early answer―Please oblige me with a speedy answer.
早速返事をしなければならぬ
We must give an answer without delay―without a moment's delay―with as little delay as possible―The answer admits of no delay.
御註文は早速着手致させ可申候
Your order shall be put in hand without delay―with the least possible delay.
急に思い立って早速立った
I suddenly took it into my head to come, and started on the instant.
早速殴ってやった

二千円ばかり早速調達して貰いたい

大金のことですから早速にはお間に合わせかねます

やりかけた仕事を早速やってしまおう
I will finish my work out of hand.
品物を早速届けてくれ
Send the article home right away!
ご到着の上は早速ご一報を願います
You will write and let me know as soon as you arrive.
落着いたら早速知らせます
I will let you know as soon as I am settled.
朝起きたなら早速この薬をお上がりなさい

御贈与の書籍早速拝読可仕候
I shall lose no time in reading the book you have kindly sent me.

content:
さっぱり
〈副〉(=少しも)(not) at all; (none) whatever; (not) the least; (not) the slightest

content.content: さっぱり面白味が無い
There is no interest at all―no interest whatever―not the least interest―not the slightest interest.
意味がさっぱりわからない
I can't make out the meaning.
ここの意味がさっぱりわからない
I can make nothing of the passage―I don't know what to make of the passage―I can't make head or tail of the passage.
先生の講義がさっぱりわからない
I can make nothing of his lectures.
どんな物だかさっぱりわからない

昨年来たばかりで中の様子がさっぱりわからない
I am new to the place, and must grope my way in the dark.
さっぱりわからない男だ
I can't make him out.
あの先生はさっぱりできない
He is no scholar.
(あの人ですか)近頃はさっぱり見えません
I have seen nothing of him.

content:
〈形〉
1. (=した)(=きちんとした)neat; natty; tidy

content.content: 身形{みなり}のさっぱりとした婦人だ
She is a tidy lady.
彼はいつもさっぱりした身形をしている

暮らしは困っているけれども子どもはさっぱりしておく

家の中はいつもさっぱりしている
The house is always neat and clean.

content: 2. (=淡白な)frank; open-hearted

content.content: 気性のさっぱりした男だ
He is a man of frank disposition―a downright good-natured fellow.
少しもさっぱりしたところの無い男だ
He is close and reserved.

content:
〈自動〉
1. (=する) (=清々する)to feel refreshed

content.content: 殺風景な男だ
He has no taste.
殺風景な庭だ
The garden is out of taste.
殺風景な眺めだ
It is a commonplace view.
彼らの生活は殺風景な生活だ
Theirs is an unromantic existence―an unpoetical existence―a prosaic existence.
殺風景な姿だ
It is a graceless figure.
男世帯は殺風景なものさ
A bachelor's home is wanting in the graces of life.
男ばかりだと殺風景だ
A party without female charms has a touch of brutality.
汽車旅行は殺風景だ
Steam has robbed travel of its poetry.
名所に広告するのは殺風景だ
The advertisements rob the views of their romance.
宴会の最中にけんかを始めたのですこぶる殺風景の観を呈した
The man who started a quarrel in the midst of the banquet was a kill-joy―a spoil-sport.
花の散った跡は殺風景だ
The flowers have fallen and left the place dreary.

content:

〈副〉
1. (=何は別として)setting apart; apart from; setting aside; aside from; independently of

content.content: 入費の問題はさて置いて今一つ考究すべき問題がある
Setting apart the question of expense,―Apart from the question of expense,―there is still another consideration.
余事はさて置いて本問題にとりかかろう
Setting aside other matters,―Aside from other matters,―we shall proceed to the main issue.
高尚な目的はさて置いて金儲けに熱中する者が多い
Many people devote themselves to money-making, apart from higher aims―aside from higher aims―independently of loftier aims.
冗談はさて置いてどうするつもりか
Joking apart, what do you mean to do?

content: 2. (=何は言うまでもなく)not to mention; not to speak of; to say nothing of; let alone

content.content: 彼は俸給はさて置いて著述の方からもだいぶ収入がある
He has a large income from his books, not to mention his salary.
英語はさて置いて仏語独語もできる
He knows French and German, not to speak of his English.
ぜいたくはさて置いて今日食うに困っている
He wants the bare necessaries of life, to say nothing of luxuries.
馬車はさて置いて俥にも乗らない
He does not ride in a ricksha, let alone a carriage.
何はさて置き
above all things―before everything―first of all
学生には何はさて置き学問が大事だ
A student should, above all, attend to his studies.
実業家は何はさて置きまず第一に時間を守らにゃならぬ
A business-man should be punctual, before everything.
しかし何はさて置き人に成れ
But be, first of all, a man!
朝起きたら何はさて置きこれをなさい
Do this the first thing in the morning!

〈他動〉To instruct; to admonish (one of one's duty); to warn (one of danger―one against a habit); to advise (one to fly); to counsel (flight); to exhort (one to work hard); to persuade (one to do something); to reason (with one on one's mistake); to talk to (one)

content.content: 彼を懇々諭してやった
I talked seriously to him.

content:
さとりひらく〔悟り開く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=悟道に入る)to find one's philosophy; to be spiritually awakened; to be spiritually enlightened; to attain spiritual enlightenment; to drink the water of life

content.content: 悟りを開くと苦楽は無くなる
Philosophy makes one indifferent to pleasure and pain.
悟り開けば死ぬのも怖くなくなる
Philosophy disarms death of its terrors.

content: 2. (=世の中はこんなものだと諦める)to take life as it is; to take the world as it is; to take things as they are; to take things like a philosopher; to take things philosophically; to use philosophy

content.content: 僕は悟り開いているから失敗しても悔しくない
I use philosophy, and frankly accept my failures.
その点については僕はとうに悟り開いている
I am an old philosopher on that point.
あの男はなかなか悟り開いている
He is quite a philosopher―very much of a philosopher.
あれは悟り開けない男だ
He can't take things as they are―He is fretful―He has a discontented spirit.

content:
さとる〔悟る、覚る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=知覚する、了解する)to perceive (a truth); to see (the truth of one's statement); to know (one's hour of death); to apprehend (the meaning); to comprehend (the sense); to grasp (the situation); to realize (one's situation); to divine (one's mind); to awake to (a fact); to be convinced of (one's error); to come to one's senses; to come to a sense of (one's folly); to be brought to a sense of (one's mistake); to have one's eyes opened (to one's error)

content.content: 真理を覚る
to perceive a truth
意味を悟る
to apprehend the meaning―comprehend the meaning―grasp the meaning
道理を悟る
to comprehend the truth
悟り難い真理
an incomprehensible truth
親父の死にようがあまり急で自分の身の上がまだ悟れない(夢のようだ)
His death happened so suddenly that I can not realize my situation.
世の味気無さを悟る
to awake to the stern realities of life
人は死期を悟るものか
Does man know his hour of death?
ひと目見てそれと覚った
I grasped the situation―saw the whole story―at a glance.
それと覚った時はもう遅かった
When I saw the truth, it was too late.
誤りを悟る
to be convinced of one's error―be undeceived
お話を承ってこれまでの誤りを悟りました
You have convinced me of my error.
彼と一日議論をしたが彼はどうしても誤りを悟らない
I have argued with him all day, but I can not convince him of his error.
やっと誤りを悟りました
I am convinced of my error―I am undeceived―I have come to my senses―I have come to a sense of my error―My eyes are opened (to my error)―The scales have fallen from my eyes.
先生のご講義を承って誤りを悟りました
Your lecture convinced me of my error―Your lecture opened my eyes (to my error)―Your lecture was an eye-opener.
今度の失敗で愚であったことを悟りました
My failure has convinced me of my folly―opened my eyes to my folly―brought me to a sense of my folly.
前非を悟る
to come to one's senses―come to a sense of one's past folly
前非を悟ったから改めます
I am convinced of my past folly, and resolved on amendment.
前非を悟って改めた
I was convinced of my past error, and amended―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A sense of my past error made me amend.
彼は自分の子どもが偉いものと誤解しているから悟らしてやろう
I will convince him of his error―open his eyes to his error―bring him to a sense of his error―as to his son's abilities.
自分は色男商売には向かないということを悟らざるを得なかった
The conviction forced itself upon me―The conclusion was forced upon me―that I was not made for this sort of business.
人の心を悟る
to divine one's mind―divine one's thoughts
彼は世間を悟り切っている
He knows the world thoroughly.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 僕は大いに悟るところがある
I have discovered my error―I have been in great error.
だんだんと事の真相を悟った
The truth dawned on my mind.
にわかに事の真相を悟った
The truth flashed on my mind.
(町内で知らぬは亭主はかりなりと言われた)彼も今頃は悟ったろう
The truth must have dawned on his mind by this.
彼に謎をかけても悟らなかった
He did not take the hint―My hints were lost upon him.
彼は大いに悟って帰った
He returned a sadder and a wiser man.

content: 2. (=勘付く、怪しむ)to suspect, be suspicious of (treachery); to smoke(treachery); to scent, get scent of (a plot); to get wind of (an affair); to sniff (danger); to smell a rat

content.content: 人に悟られると大変だから油断をするな
You must be on your guard, lest you should incur suspicion.
悟られないように別々に行った
We went each by himself to disarm suspicion.
二人の仲を主人に悟られた
Their master suspected the relations between the two.
相手が裏切りしそうな様子を悟った
I suspected treachery―I was suspicious of treachery―I smoked treachery.
その男は事が喧しくなりそうだと悟って逐電した
The man got wind of the affair, and absconded.
こいつ怪しいなと悟った
I smelled a rat.

content: 〈自動〉(=悟り開く)to philosophize; to find one's philosophy; to use philosophy; to take things philosophically; to take things like a philosopher

content.content: 悟ってみれば苦楽も無くなる
Philosophy makes one indifferent to pleasure and pain.
悟ってみれば死ぬのも恐ろしくなくなる
Philosophy disarms death of its terrors.
僕は悟っているから失敗しても悔しくない
I use philosophy, and frankly accept my failures.
その点については僕はとうに悟っている
I am an old philosopher on that point.
あの男はなかなか悟っている
He is quite a philosopher―very much of a philosopher.

content.content: 真理を覚る
to perceive a truth
意味を悟る
to apprehend the meaning―comprehend the meaning―grasp the meaning
道理を悟る
to comprehend the truth
悟り難い真理
an incomprehensible truth
親父の死にようがあまり急で自分の身の上がまだ悟れない(夢のようだ)
His death happened so suddenly that I can not realize my situation.
世の味気無さを悟る
to awake to the stern realities of life
人は死期を悟るものか

ひと目見てそれと覚った
I grasped the situation―saw the whole story―at a glance.
それと覚った時はもう遅かった

to be convinced of one's error―be undeceived
お話を承ってこれまでの誤りを悟りました

I am convinced of my error―I am undeceived―I have come to my senses―I have come to a sense of my error―My eyes are opened (to my error)―The scales have fallen from my eyes.
先生のご講義を承って誤りを悟りました
Your lecture convinced me of my error―Your lecture opened my eyes (to my error)―Your lecture was an eye-opener.
今度の失敗で愚であったことを悟りました
My failure has convinced me of my folly―opened my eyes to my folly―brought me to a sense of my folly.
前非を悟る
to come to one's senses―come to a sense of one's past folly
前非を悟ったから改めます
I am convinced of my past folly, and resolved on amendment.
前非を悟って改めた
I was convinced of my past error, and amended―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A sense of my past error made me amend.
彼は自分の子どもが偉いものと誤解しているから悟らしてやろう
I will convince him of his error―open his eyes to his error―bring him to a sense of his error―as to his son's abilities.
自分は色男商売には向かないということを悟らざるを得なかった
The conviction forced itself upon me―The conclusion was forced upon me―that I was not made for this sort of business.
人の心を悟る
to divine one's mind―divine one's thoughts
彼は世間を悟り切っている
He knows the world thoroughly.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 僕は大いに悟るところがある
I have discovered my error―I have been in great error.
だんだんと事の真相を悟った
The truth dawned on my mind.
にわかに事の真相を悟った
The truth flashed on my mind.
(町内で知らぬは亭主はかりなりと言われた)彼も今頃は悟ったろう
The truth must have dawned on his mind by this.
彼に謎をかけても悟らなかった
He did not take the hint―My hints were lost upon him.
彼は大いに悟って帰った
He returned a sadder and a wiser man.

content: 2. (=勘付く、怪しむ)to suspect, be suspicious of (treachery); to smoke(treachery); to scent, get scent of (a plot); to get wind of (an affair); to sniff (danger); to smell a rat

content.content: 人に悟られると大変だから油断をするな
You must be on your guard, lest you should incur suspicion.
悟られないように別々に行った
We went each by himself to disarm suspicion.
二人の仲を主人に悟られた
Their master suspected the relations between the two.
相手が裏切りしそうな様子を悟った
I suspected treachery―I was suspicious of treachery―I smoked treachery.
その男は事が喧しくなりそうだと悟って逐電した
The man got wind of the affair, and absconded.
こいつ怪しいなと悟った
I smelled a rat.

content: 〈自動〉(=悟り開く)to philosophize; to find one's philosophy; to use philosophy; to take things philosophically; to take things like a philosopher

content.content: 悟ってみれば苦楽も無くなる
Philosophy makes one indifferent to pleasure and pain.
悟ってみれば死ぬのも恐ろしくなくなる
Philosophy disarms death of its terrors.
僕は悟っているから失敗しても悔しくない
I use philosophy, and frankly accept my failures.
その点については僕はとうに悟っている
I am an old philosopher on that point.
あの男はなかなか悟っている
He is quite a philosopher―very much of a philosopher.

content:
さながら〔宛ら〕
〈副〉So to speak; as it were; in a manner:(前置詞に用いれば)like; just like:(接続詞に用いれば)as if; as though; just as if

content.content: さながら成人せる赤ん坊だ
He is so to speak, a grown-up baby.
さながら一幅の絵である
It is just like a picture.
さながら目の前に地図を拡げたよう
It is just as if a map were spread before you.
彼はさながら自国語のように英語を話す
He speaks English as if it were his mother tongue―like one to the manner born.
彼は自分の子どもをさながら厄介物のように思っている
He regards his children as so many encumbrances.

さなぎ〔蛹〕
〈名〉A chrysalis; a pupa; a nymph

content:
さなきだに
〈副〉To add to...

content.content: さなきだに困っているところへ病人までもできた
To add to our troubles, one of us fell ill.
さなきだに悪いのにその年は凶作であった
To add to the evil,―To make matters worse,―the harvest failed.
さなきだに騒がしい世の中にペルリが艦隊を率いて来た
To add to the troubles, Perry arrived with his squadron.
さなきだに賑かな大都会にひとしおの賑いを添える
to add to the stir and bustle of a great city

content:
さなだ〔真田〕
〈名〉Braid; plait; tape

content.content: 真田を編む
to plait straw―braid chips
麦わら真田
straw plait
経木真田
chip braid
ゴム真田
elastic tape
真田類
narrow goods

content:
さなだむし〔真田虫〕
〈名〉The tapeworm

content.content: 真田虫がわいたようだ
I am afraid I have a tapeworm.
真田虫が出た
I have passed a tapeworm.

content:
さね〔核〕
〈名〉A stone

content.content: 核果{さねみ}
a drupe
核はなれのする桃
a freestone peach
核はなれのせぬ桃
a clingstone peach

content:
さの〔左の〕
〈形〉The following

content.content: 左の如し
They are as follows:―

content:
さのみ
〈副〉(Not) so; (not) much; (not) very

content.content: さのみ悦びもせぬ
He was not so glad.
さのみ驚きもせぬ
He was not much surprised.
さのみ好い文章ではない
It is not a very good style.

content:
さば〔鯖〕
〈名〉The mackerel

content.content: 鯖がたくさん取れる
Great quantities of mackerels are caught.
鯖を読む
to count less than the actual number―cheat a tradesman by miscounting

content:
さはい〔差配〕
〈名〉Agency; management; superintendence:(=する) to act as agent; to manage; to superintend

content.content: 人の所有地を差配する
to manage a property
私が長屋の差配をしております
I superintend the tenement-house.
差配人
(家屋のは)a house-agent―(地所のは)―a land-agent
差配所
the agency
ご用の方は差配まで
Please inquire at the Agency.

content:
さばき〔捌き〕
〈名〉
1. (=ほどくこと)disentanglement; unravelling
2. (=処置)management; disposal; treatment; manipulation

content.content: 多くの糸を片手に持ってそのさばきが巧みだ
He holds many lines in one hand, and manipulates them with dexterity―handles them with dexterity.
さばきをつける
to manage a difficult matter

content: 3. (=裁断)decision; judgment

content.content: 片手落ちのさばきだ
It is partial judgment.
粋なおさばきだ
It is a delicate judgment.
僕にはさばきがつかぬ
I can not decide―come to a decision.
出る処へ出ておさばきを受けよう
Let us appear before the magistrate!

content:
さばく〔佐幕〕
〈名〉Adherence to the Shogunate

content.content: 佐幕党
the adherents of the Shogunate―the Shogunate party

content:
さばく〔沙漠〕
〈名〉A desert

content.content: 沙漠は雨が降らぬ
No rain falls in the desert.

content:
さばく〔捌く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=ほどく)to disentangle; to unravel
2. (=売る)to sell
3. (=処置する)to manage; to treat; to handle; to manipulate; to dispose of (anything); to deal with (anything)

content.content: たくさんの糸を片手に持って巧みにこれをさばく
Holding many lines in one hand, he handles them with dexterity―manipulates them with dexterity.
難事をさばく
to manage a difficult matter―deal a difficult situation
この難問は僕にはさばけない
I can not deal with this hard problem.

content: 4. (=裁断する)to decide; to judge

content.content: 事件をさばく
to decide on a case―pass judgment on a case

content:
さばけ〔捌け〕
〈名〉
1. Sale; a market

content.content: この品はさばけが好い
These goods sell well―find ready sale―find a good market.
さばけが悪い
They do not sell―find no sale―find no market.
みずはけ〔水排け〕

content:
さばけぐち〔捌け口〕
〈名〉A market

content.content: さばけ口を見つける
to find a market for one's wares

content:
さばけた〔捌けた〕
〈形〉Used to the world; human; humanized

content.content: さばけた人だ
He is a man of the world.
さばけた考えを持っている
He has human ideas―humanized ideas.
彼の処置はたいそうさばけている
His conduct is very human.
君はさばけたことを言う
You talk sense.
あの人はさばけが悪いね
He wants humanizing.

content:
さばける〔捌ける〕
〈自動〉
1. (=解ける)to be disentangled; to be unravelled
2. (=売れる)to sell; to be salable; to be marketable; to be merchantable

content.content: こういう品はずんずんさばける
These goods sell well―find ready sale―find a good market.
こんな品はさばけない
Such goods do not sell―find no sale―find no market.

さばさば
〈形〉Refreshing:(=する) to feel refreshed

さはさりながら
〈副〉Be that as it may; however (that may be)

content:
さび〔錆〕
〈名〉
1. Rust:(=る) to rust; to become rusty:(=た) rusty

content.content: 錆びた刀
a rusty sword
刀は錆だらけだ
The sword is incrusted with rust―eaten up with rust.
鉄は錆びやすい
Iron is apt to rust.
鎧の錆を落す
to furbish up an armour
錆を止める
to keep iron from rusting
いざ鎌倉といふ時槍が錆びておらぬよう
Keep your sword bright against the day of battle.
槍は錆びても名は錆びぬ
My sword may rust, but I keep my honour bright.
彼は名が錆びた
He has a tarnished reputation.
刀の錆にする
to put a man to the sword
刀の錆になる
to fall beneath the sword
身から出た錆だ
They are the consequences of your own deeds.

content: 2. (=古色)an antique look:(銅器などの古色)patina

content.content: 錆が付く
to acquire an antique look
この庭はだいぶ錆が付いて来た
The garden has quite an antique look.
錆の有る声
a seasoned voice
錆が有って実に好い声だ
He has a beautiful well-seasoned voice.

content:
さびしい〔淋しい〕
〈形〉
1. (=心淋しい)Lonely (feeling); forlorn (widow, etc.)

content.content: さびしい心持
a lonely feeling
お独りでおさびしいでしょう
You must feel lonely by yourself.
さびしかったら誰かに付合って貰います
When I feel lonely, I will get some one to bear me company.
そのうちになんだか淋しくなってきた
A lonely feeling stole over me.
未亡人はさびしい月日を送っている
The widow leads a lonely life―lives a forlorn life.
君がいなくなるとさびしい
I shall miss you very much.
彼がいなくともさびしくない
I do not miss him―I prefer his room to his company.

content: 2. (=もの淋しい)lonesome (place); desolate (scene); deserted (air); dreary (scenery); bleak (view); solitary (house); pensive (look); wan (smile, etc.)

content.content: さびしい処
a lonesome place
さびしい景色
a desolate scene―a dreary scene
冬の景色はさびしい
A winter scene is bleak and dreary.
焼跡はさびしい
The scene of a late fire is desolate.
市街に人通りが無くてさびしい
The streets are deserted.
山中のさびしい一軒家だ
It is a solitary cottage among the mountains.
あの女はさびしい顔をしている
She has a pensive look.
そう言いながらさびしい笑い顔をした
So saying, she smiled a wan smile.
懐がさびしい
My purse is empty.

content:
さびつく〔錆付く〕
〈自動〉To rust to (anything)

content.content: 刀が錆付いて抜けない
The sword has rusted to the sheath and will not draw.

content:
さびどめ〔錆止め〕
〈名〉An anticorrosive

content.content: 錆止めをする
to treat iron with an anticorrosive

content:
さびれる〔淋れる〕
〈自動〉To become desolate; to fall into decay; to decline

content.content: 鉄道ができてから宿場はさびれた
Since the railway was laid, the towns on the road have fallen into decay.
中には火の消えたようにさびれた処がある
Some of them have a desolate air―a deserted air.
あの店は近頃さびれた
The shop is on the decline―The custom is falling off.

content:
ザブザブ
〈副〉With splashes

content.content: ザブザブ水の中を歩く
to paddle in the water
ザブザフ水を掛ける
to throw water on or over anything

content:
ざぶとん〔座蒲団〕
〈名〉A cushion

content.content: 座蒲団をお敷きなさい
Take a cushion!

content:
サフラン
〈名〉The saffron

content.content: サフラン色
saffron

content:
ざぶりと〔ザブリと〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: ざぶんと〔ザブンと〕

content:
ざぶりと〔ザブリと〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: ざぶんと〔ザブンと〕

content:
ざぶんと〔ザブンと〕
〈副〉With a splash

content.content: ザブンと飛び込む
to splash into the water

content:
ざぶんと〔ザブンと〕
〈副〉With a splash

content.content: ザブンと飛び込む
to splash into the water

content:
さべつ〔差別〕
〈名〉Distinction; discrimination:(=する) to distinguish (between right and wrong―right from wrong); to discriminate (between good and bad―good from bad); to know (friend from foe); can tell (friend from foe)

content.content: 正邪を差別する
to distinguish between right and wrong
善悪を差別する
to discriminate between good and bad
彼は敵味方の差別をも知らぬ
He does not know friend from foe―He can not tell friend from foe.
僕は日本人と西洋人を差別して扱わぬ
I do not discriminate between Japanese and foreigners.
西洋人を差別して優待はせぬ
I do not discriminate in favour of foreigners.
米国では日本人を差別して虐待する
In America, they discriminate against the Japanese.
差別のある待遇
discriminative treatment
差別の無い待遇
indiscriminate treatment
貴賤上下の差別無く入会を許す
Everybody is admitted without distinction of rank or standing―irrespectives of rank or standing.
老若男女の差別無く取扱う
They are treated without distinction of age or sex―irrespective of age or sex.

content:
サーベル
〈名〉A sabre

content.content: 腰のサーベル
the sabre by one's side

content:
さほう〔左方〕
〈名〉The left; the left side

content.content: 左方は崖になっている
There is a precipice on the left.
道路の左方に当たって丘がある
(To the) left of the road rises a hill.

content:
さほう〔作法〕
〈名〉Manners; breeding; behaviour; propriety

content.content: この子は作法を知らないね
The child has no manners.
お前は作法を知らんのか
Where is your manners?―Where is your hat?
あれは行儀作法のある人だ
He is a man of breeding―He is well bred.
行儀作法に気をつけなさい
Learn to behave―Mind your P's and Q's.
行儀作法を見ならう
to learn good manners
女の子は行儀作法を見ならいに良家へ奉公する
Girls take service in good families to learn their manners.
作法を崩す
to do something improper
彼は気の毒なほど作法を崩さない
He is painfully proper.

さぼてん〔覇王樹<サボテン>〕
〈名〉The cactus; the prickly pear

さぼてん〔覇王樹<サボテン>〕
〈名〉The cactus; the prickly pear

content:
さほど〔左程〕
〈副〉(Not) so much; (not) so; (not) much; (not) very; (not) particularly

content.content: さほど大事なことでもない
The matter is not very important―not of much consequence.
さほどの病気でもない
He is not so very ill―It is not a serious illness.
さほど面白くもない
It is not particularly interesting.
さほどまで私のことを思って下さるのですか
Do you love me so?
来てみればさほどにもなし富士の山
It does not come up to my expectations―It falls short of my expectations.
先やさほどにも思いやせぬのに
She does not care for me so much as I do for her.

さぼる〔サボる〕
〈自動〉To go on sabotage

さぼる〔サボる〕
〈自動〉To go on sabotage

content:
さま〔様〕
〈名〉
1. (=ありさま)a state; condition; a plight; a predicament

content.content: それはなんというさまだ
What a plight you are in!

content: 2. (=形、なりふり)appearance

content.content: このさまでは人前に出られぬ
I am not fit to be seen―unpresentable.

content:
3. 
〈人の名に付ける敬語〉Mr. (Mister の略にて男子の名に付す); Messrs. (Messieurs の略にて Mister の複数); Esq. (Esquire の略にて男子の名の後に付して手紙の上書きに用いる); Mrs. (Mistress の略にて夫人の名に付す); Miss(未婚婦人の名に付す)

content.content: お父様
Father.
お母様
Mother.
ご馳走さま
I have enjoyed myself very much.
お気の毒さま
I am sorry for you.
おあいにくさま
We are out of the article―The article is out of stock.

content:
ざま〔様〕
〈名〉A state; a plight; a predicament

content.content: ひどいザマだ
He is in a sorry plight.
そのザマはどうだい
What a plight you are in!
このザマでは人様の前へ出られない
I am not fit to the seen―unpresentable.
ザマ見やがれ
Serve you right!
怠けるものだからそのザマ見ろ
See what your idleness has brought you to!
見られたザマかい
What a horrid spectacle!
女の酒に酔ったのは見られたザマじゃない
A drunken woman is a horrid spectacle.
生きザマ死にザマ
As men live, so they die.

content:
さまざま〔様々〕
〈形〉Various; diverse; divers; sundry; all sorts of; all manner of; every description of (goods, etc.)

content.content: あの店にはさまざまの物がある
They sell all sorts of things at that shop.
さまざまの人と付合って見た
I have seen all sorts of men―all sorts and conditions of men―all manner of men.
その袋にはさまざまの物が入っている
The bag is filled with sundries.
彼は僕にさまざまな悪口を言った
He called me names.
人の心はさまざま
“Many men, many minds”―“No two men are alike.”
人の嗜好はさまざま
Tastes will differ.
医者もさまざま
There are doctors and doctors.

content:
さます〔覚ます〕
〈他動〉(=目を覚ます)To awake; to wake up; to be awakened (by a noise); to be aroused (by the sun)

content.content: 君は(起こされないで)独りで目を覚ますか
Do you awake of yourself?―wake up of yourself?
目を覚ましてみると見慣れぬ処に寝ておった
I awoke to find myself lying in a strange place.
目を覚ましている
I am awake.
目を覚まして寝ておった
I lay awake in bed.
(彼女は寝ている時だけは忘れているが)目を覚ましている時は泣きづめだ
She keeps crying when she is awake―in her waking hours.
僕は夜中に時々目を覚ます
I wake up several times during the night―I have a broken sleep.
目を覚まさせる
to awaken one―wake one from sleep―arouse one from torpor
その音で目を覚ました
I was awakened by the noise―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The noise awakened me.
(君がそんな大きな声を出すと)子どもが目を覚ますよ
You will awaken the child.
朝日が射し込んで目を覚ました
The morning sun, shining into my room, woke me from my sleep―aroused me from my torpor.

content:
さます〔醒ます〕
〈他動〉
1. (=酔いを醒ます)to make (one) sober

content.content: 自分で酔いをさます
to get rid of the effects of wine―make oneself sober
風に吹かれて酔いをさましている
I am standing in the breeze to get rid of the effects of wine.
寝て酔いをさます
to sleep oneself sober―sleep off one's debauch

content: 2. (=迷夢を醒ます)to disillusion (one); to disenchant (one); to awaken (one) from one's illusions; to bring (one) to one's senses

content.content: (放蕩息子がまだ目がさめぬなら)己が目をさましてやる
I will bring him to his senses.
失敗をすると青年が迷夢をさますから失敗は青年に薬だ
Failure does a young man good, for it disillusions him from his dreams―awakes him from his illusions.

content:
さます〔冷ます〕
〈他動〉
1. To cool; to let (it) cool

content.content: 湯を冷ます
to let hot water cool
湯を吹いて冷ませ
Blow the hot water till it is cool.
冷まして飲め
Drink it when it is cool―Wait till it is cool.
風呂を冷ますな
Keep the bath hot.
熱を冷ます
to allay the fever―bring down the fever
ほとぼりをさまして帰れ
Return after the storm has blown over―Wait till the storm blows over.
熱心を冷ます
to cool one's zeal―damp one's ardour
好奇心を冷ます
to bate one's curiosity
情を冷ます
to put one out of love
興を冷ます
to spoil the pleasure―spoil the fun―break the spell
役者が失錯などすると興を冷ますことがある
A mistake on the part of the actor will break the spell.
遊楽の興を冷ます
to damp the ardour of pleasure

content:
さまたげ〔妨げ〕
〈名〉［注意］英語を標準とす。
1. Disturbance (of repose):(=る) to disturb (one's repose)

content.content: 安眠を妨げる
to disturb one's repose
人の勉強を妨げる
to disturb (one in) one's studies
お勉強のお妨げになるかと思って入らなかった
I did not come in lest I should disturb you in your studies.

content: 2. Interruption (of the view):(=る) to interrupt (the view)

content.content: 人の話を妨げる
to interrupt (one in) one's talk
演説を妨げる
to interrupt (one in) one's speech
講義を妨げる
to interrupt (one in) one's lecture
質問をして講義を妨げる
to interrupt a lecture with questions
君の質問は講義の妨げになる
You interrupt the lecture with your questions―Your questions interrupt the lecture.
あの木は眺めを妨げる
That tree interrupts the view.

content: 3. Interference (with business):(=る) to interfere with (business)

content.content: 君の質問は講義の妨げになる
Your questions interfere with the lecture.
授業中談話はいかん、授業の妨げになる
No talking in class! It interferes with the class-work.
遊ぶもよろしいが勉強の妨げにならぬように
Your pleasure must not interfere with your studies.
職務の妨げにならぬ限りは何をしてもよろしい
You may do anything so long as it does not interferes with your duties.
病気が働きの妨げになる
Illness interferes with one's work.
家族が大勢あると活動の妨げになる
A large family interferes with one's activity.
営業を妨げる
to interfere with one's business

content: 4. Prevention (of activity):(=る) to prevent (one from doing anything)

content.content: 病気は働きの妨げになる
Illness prevents one from working.
身体の弱いのが活動の妨げとなった
The weakness of his constitution prevented him from taking an active part in life-business―prevented his activity.

content: 5. A hindrance (to success):(=る) to hinder (one from accomplishing one's purpose)

content.content: 困難がたくさんあって目的を遂げる妨げとなった
Many difficulties hindered me from accomplishing my purpose.
この困難が成功の妨げである
This difficulty is a hindrance to success―This difficulty hinders success.
病気は勉強の妨げになる
Illness is a hindrance to study.
身体の弱いのが活動の妨げとなった
The weakness of his constitution proved a hindrance to his activity.
外部の干渉が事業の進行を妨げる
Outside interference hinders the progress of the work.
迷信は進歩の妨げになる
Superstition is a hindrance to progress.
寒さが発育を妨げる
Cold hinders growth.
何の妨げも無く事が運んだ
The matter proceeded without let or hindrance.

content: 6. An impediment (to progress):(=る) to impede (progress)

content.content: 軍隊の行李が行進の妨げになる
The baggage of an army impedes its progress―The baggage of an army is an impediment to its progress.
外部の干渉が事業行進を妨げる
Outside interference impedes the progress of the work.
病気は勉強の妨げとなる
Illness is an impediment to study.
身体の弱いのが活動の妨げとなった
The weakness of his constitution proved an impediment to his activity.
迷信は進歩の妨げになる
Superstition is an impediment to progress.

content: 7. An obstruction (to traffic):(=る) to obstruct (traffic)

content.content: 通行を妨げる
to obstruct traffic
通行の妨げ
an obstruction to traffic
あの木が眺めを妨げる
The tree obstructs the view.
河があると軍隊の行進を妨げる
A river obstructs the progress of an army.
議事を妨げる
to obstruct proceedings

content: 8. An obstacle (to success―in the way of success):(=る) to stand in the way of (success)

content.content: この困難は成功の妨げになる
This difficulty is an obstacle to success―This difficulty stands in the way of success.
君の成功を妨げる者が無い
There is no obstacle in the path of your success―There is nothing in the way of your success―Nothing stands in the way of your success.
身分の違いが二人の交際の妨げになった
The difference of rank proved an obstacle to their intercourse.
人の成功を妨げる
(無意志なら)to stand in the way of one's success―(有意志なら)―throw an obstacle in the way of one's success
我が大望を妨ぐるものは彼一人である
He is the only obstacle in the way of my ambition.

content: 9. A bar (to progress―in the way of success):(=る) to bar (progress―one from succeeding)

content.content: 通行を妨げる
to bar the way―bar the path
接近を妨げる
to bar access (to a person)
出入を妨げる
to bar egress―bar ingress
迷信は進歩の妨げになる
Superstition is a bar to progress.
この困難が成功の妨げになる
This difficulty is a bar in the way of success.
外部の干渉は事業の進行を妨げる
Outside interference bars the progress of the work.
身体の弱いのが彼の活動の妨げとなった
The weakness of his constitution barred him from activity.
身分の違いが二人の交際の妨げとなった
The difference of rank proved a bar to their intercourse.
我が大望の妨げは彼一人である
He is the only bar to my ambition.

content: 10. A barrier (to progress or success―between rich and poor)

content.content: この困難が成功の妨げになる
This difficulty is a barrier to my success.
身分の違いが二人の交際の妨げになった
The difference of rank proved a barrier to their intercourse―Rank stood a barrier between the two.
我が大望の妨げになるものは彼一人である
He is the only barrier to my ambition.

content: 11. A check (to motion or speed):(=る) to check (motion or speed)

content.content: 雪が汽車の進行を妨げた
The snow checked the progress of the train.
これから都まで行く途中に我が軍の行進を妨げる要塞が無い
There are no fortresses on the road to check our march on the capital.

content: 12. A clog (to person―on his movement or activity)

content.content: 女や子どもは活動の妨げになる
Women and children are a clog to an active man―a clog on a man's activity.

content: 13. A drag (to a person―on his movement or activity)

content.content: 彼の身分が出世の妨げになった
His social position was a drag to the rising man―a drag on his career.

content: 14. A drawback (to a person or a thing)

content.content: 貧は学問をする者の妨げになる
Poverty is a drawback to a student.
嫉妬は友情の妨げになる
Envy is a drawback to friendship.
盲目は人生を楽しむ妨げにはならぬものと見える
It seems that blindness is no drawback to the enjoyment of life.

content: 15. Counterwork:(=る) to counterwork, work against (one's cause)

content.content: 人の事業を妨げる
to counterwork one's cause―work against one's cause
船の進行を妨げる
to retard the progress of a ship
借金のために運動の自由を妨げられた
I was hampered by debts.
財政困難のために活動を妨げられた
I was handicapped by financial embarrassment.
人の計画を妨げる
to oppose―set one's face against―a scheme
彼を妨げるな
Do not cross his wishes!―Do not thwart his purpose!

content:
17. 
〈以上の共通点〉

content.content: 勉強の妨げ
a hindrance to study―an impediment to study
勉強を妨げる
to disturb one in one's studies―interfere with one's studies―prevent one from studying
授業を妨げる
to interrupt one in one's lecture―interfere with the class-work
眺めを妨げる
to obstruct the view―interrupt the view
活動の妨げ
a hindrance to one's activity―an impediment to one's activity―a clog on one's activity―a drag on one's activity
活動を妨げる
to interfere with one's activity―prevent one's activity―hinder one's activity―impede one's activity―hamper one's activity―handicap one's activity―bar one from activity
成功の妨げ
a hindrance to success―an impediment to success―a bar to success―a barrier to success
成功を妨げる
to hinder success―impede success―bar success―stand in the way of success―prove an obstacle to success―throw an obstacle in the way of one's success
出世の妨げ

a hindrance to one's advancement―an impediment to one's advancement―an obstacle to one's advancement―a bar to one's advancement―a barrier to one's advancement―a clog on one's career―a drag on one's career
進行(進歩)の妨げ
a hindrance to progress―an impediment to progress―a bar to progress
進行(進歩)を妨げる
to hinder progress―impede progress―bar progress
軍隊の行進を妨げる
to impede―obstruct―check―bar―the progress of an army
発育(発達)を妨げる
to hinder―impede―check―growth or development
通行を妨げる
to obstruct traffic―bar the way
交際の妨げ
an obstacle to intercourse―a bar to intercourse―a barrier to intercourse
大望の妨げ
an obstacle to―a bar to―a barrier to―one's ambition

さまつ〔瑣末〕
〈形〉Trifling, trivial, insignificant (matter); petty (faults, etc.)

content:
さまづけする〔様付けする〕
〈他動〉To mister (a name)

content.content: 彼は召使いにまで様付けする
He misters the servants.
人はずっと偉くなると様付けしなくなる
When a man is supremely great, his name is shortened of the “Mr”―curtailed of the “Mr. ”

content:
さまで〔左まで〕
〈副〉(Not) so; (not) much

content.content: さまでの病気じゃない
He is not so very ill―His illness is not serious.
さまでのことでない
The matter is not serious―not so serious―of no consequence.

content:
さまよう
〈自他動〉To wander about (the world); to stroll about (the streets); to ramble about (the woods); to rove

content.content: 彼らは快楽を追って世界中をさまよう
They wander about the world in pursuit of pleasure.
彼は当ても無くさまよっている
He is wandering about aimlessly.
魂魄この世にさまよう
His spirit haunts the old scenes.
さまよえる者
a wanderer―a rover

content:
さみせん〔三味線〕
〈名〉The Japanese three-stringed guitar

content.content: 三味線を弾く
to play (on) the samisen―twang the samisen
三味線をはだける
to thrum the samisen―strum the samisen
三味線に合わして歌う
to sing to the samisen (accompaniment)

さみだれ〔五月雨〕
〈名〉Early summer rains; the rainy season

content:
さむい〔寒い〕
〈形〉Cold

content.content: お寒くなりました
It is getting colder―The cold days have come―The cold weather has set in.
おお寒い
How cold it is!
寒いじゃないか
Cold, isn't it?
寒くてたままらん
I can't stand the cold―The cold is intolerable.
皆寒い寒いと言っている
They all complain of the cold.
あそこは冬はひどく寒い
It is bitterly cold there in winter.
肌を刺すように寒い
It is biting cold.
今は寒い絶頂だ
The cold is at its height―We are in the height of the cold season.
寒くて震える
I shiver with cold.
寒くてちぢかむ、身が縮まるほど寒い
I am huddled up with cold.
寒くて歯ががたがたする
My teeth chatter with cold.
寒くて手がこごえる
My hands are benumbed with cold.
夜は寒くて寝られない
The nights are too cold to sleep.
これだけ毛布を着て寝りゃ寒くない
These blankets will keep you warm.
君は暑い寒いを苦にするか
Are you sensitive to heat or cold?
僕は暑い寒いはいっこう平気だ
I am quite indifferent to heat or cold.
僕は寒いのはかまわないが暑いのは閉口だ
I don't mind cold, but I can't stand heat.
暑いのより寒い方がしのぎやすい
Cold is easier to stand than heat.
暑い寒いも彼岸まで
No summer's heat or winter's cold lasts over the equinox―When the equinox comes, good-by to heat or cold.
暑い寒いの挨拶をする
to exchange the common civilities of life
寒い冬
a severe winter
今年は寒い
We have a severe winter this year.
狼の遠吠は肝胆を寒からしむ
The wolf's howl will curdle your blood―make your blood run cold.
猛虎一声肝胆寒し
A tiger's roar will strike terror to the bravest heart.

content:
さむがり〔寒がり〕
〈名〉One who is sensitive to cold; a chilly mortal

content.content: 僕は寒がりだ
I am sensitive to cold.
しかし君のような寒がりは無いな
I never saw such a chilly mortal as you are.

content:
さむがる〔寒がる〕
〈自動〉To be sensitive to cold; to feel the cold; to complain of the cold

content.content: 彼は寒がって震えている
He is shivering with cold.
寒がってちぢかんでいる
He is huddled up with cold.
寒がって火にばかり当たっている
He nurses the fire―covers over the fire―hugs the chimney-corner.

content:
さむけ〔寒気〕
〈名〉A chill; a cold fit; rigor

content.content: 寒気がする
to feel a chill―have a chill―have a cold fit―have a chill come over one―A chill comes over one
彼は寒気がすると言っている
He complains of a chill.
あの男には皆寒気を立てている
Everybody abhors that man―He is abhorrent to everybody.

content:
さむさ〔寒さ〕
〈名〉The cold (of winter)

content.content: 厳しい寒さです
It is bitterly cold―The cold is intense.
肌刺す寒さ
a biting cold
今年は二十年来の寒さだ
This is the severest winter we have had for twenty years.
君は寒さを苦にするか
Are you sensitive to cold?
寒さを防ぐ
to protect oneself from the cold―keep out the cold
寒さを避ける
to go somewhere for the winter―pass the winter somewhere
熱海へ寒さを避けた
I went to Atami for the winter―I passed the winter at Atami.
寒さに堪える、寒さをしのぐ
to stand the cold
暑さより寒さの方がしのぎやすい
Cold is easier to stand than heat.
熱海へ行って寒さをしのごう
I will go to Atami for the winter―pass the winter at Atami.
今日の寒さは零度以下だ
The mercury stands below zero.

content:
さむぞら〔寒空〕
〈名〉A wintry sky; cold weather

content.content: この寒空になんでまああなたが帰されようか
How can I let you go away under this wintry sky?

content:
さむらい〔武士〕
〈名〉A samurai

content.content: お座敷さむらい
a carpet knight

content:
さめざめと〔潜々と〕
〈副〉Copiously

content.content: さめざめと泣く
to weep copiously―weep copious tears
一人の女がさめざめと泣いておった
A woman was crying bitterly.

content:
さめはだ〔鮫肌〕
〈名〉Goose-flesh; goose-skin

content.content: あの人は鮫肌だ
He has a goose-skin.

content:
さめる〔覚める〕
〈自動〉To awake; to wake up; to be awakened (by a noise); to be aroused (by the sun)

content.content: 目が覚める
to awake―wake up―(迷夢が醒めるの意味なら)―come to one's senses
君は(朝起こされずに)独りで目が覚めるか
Do you awake of yourself?―wake up of yourself?
目が覚めてみると見慣れぬ処に寝ておった
I awoke to find myself lying in a strange place.
目が覚めている
I am awake.
僕は夜中に時々目が覚める
I wake up several times during the night―I have a broken sleep.
その音で目が覚めた
I was awakened by the noise―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The noise awakened me.
朝日が射し込んで目が覚めた
The morning sun, shining into my room, awakened me from my sleep―aroused me from my torpor.
やっと目が覚めた
I have come to my senses―My eyes are opened―The scales have fallen from my eyes.
放蕩息子はまだ目が覚めぬ
The prodigal son has not come to his senses yet.
目が覚めて事の真相が見えてきた
My eyes are opened,―The scales have fallen from my eyes,―and I view the matter in its true light.
失敗して目が覚めた
My failure has brought me to my senses―brought me to a sense of my folly―My failure has been an eye-opener.
彼は金を使い果たしてやっと目が覚めた
His empty purse brought him to his senses.
僕は目が覚めやすい、目が覚め難い
I am a light sleeper―a heavy sleeper.
目が覚めるような色だ
It is a fresh colour―a vivid colour.
夢が覚める
to awake from a dream―awake from sleep―(迷夢が醒めるの意味なら)―come to one's senses

content:
さめる〔醒める〕
〈自動〉
1. (=酔いが醒める)to become sober

content.content: (彼は酔ったのだから)寝かしておくと醒める
He will sleep himself sober―sleep off his debauch.
もう酒が醒めたか
Are you sober now?
すっかり醒めた
I am quite sober.
いやなことを聞いてせっかく飲んだ酒が醒めてしまった
The bad news has sobered me.
醒めての上の御分別
I “appeal from Philip drunk to Philip sober.”

content: 2. (=迷夢が醒める)to be disillusioned; to be disenchanted; to be awakened from one's illusions; to come to one's senses

content.content: 放蕩息子はまだ夢が醒めぬ
The prodigal son has not come to his senses yet.
苦しませると夢が醒める
Suffering will bring him to his senses.
金を使い果たしてやっと夢が醒めた
His empty purse has brought him to his senses.
青年は失敗すると迷夢が醒めるものだ
Failure will disillusion a young man from his dreams―awaken a young man from his illusions.
夢の醒めた時には白髪の老爺になっておった
When he came to his senses, he found himself a gray-haired old man.

content:
さめる〔冷める〕
〈自動〉To cool; to get cold

content.content: 冷めないうちにお上がり
Eat it while it is hot.
風呂の冷めないようにせよ
Keep the bath hot!
熱が冷める
Fever abates.
熱が冷めた
The fever has abated.
熱心が冷める
One's ardour cools―One's ardour is dampened―One's enthusiasm cools down.
熱い恋は冷めやすい
Hot love is soon cold.
熱しやすきは冷めやすし
One who is soon hot, is soon cold―Soon hot, soon cold.
年をとると情が冷める
As one grows older, one will grow out of love―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Age puts one out of love.
興が冷める、お座が冷める
The spell is broken.
役者が失錯でもするとお座が冷める
A mistake on the part of the actor will break the spell.
ほとぼりが冷めるまで姿を隠すがよい
You had better keep out of sight till the storm blows over.

content:
さめる〔褪める〕
〈自動〉To fade; to fly; to go off; to lose colour

content.content: この色は褪める
This colour will fade―fly―go off.
この織物は色が褪める
This cloth will lose colour.
この色は褪めない
This colour will hold fast.
この色は洗っても褪めない
This colour will wash―stand washing.
褪める色
a fading colour―a fugitive colour
褪めない色
an unfading colour―a fast colour

content:
さも
〈副〉So; just; exactly; evidently:(接続詞に用いれば)as if; just as if

content.content: さもうまそうに食う
He eats with evident relish―with gusto.
さも満足そうに微笑した
He smiled with evident satisfaction.
さも嬉しそうだ
He looks so glad.
さも嬉しそうに眺めていた
He was gloating over the sight.
有りし事にさも似たり
It looks just like a fact―exactly like a fact.
さも本当らしく言う
He talks as if it were true.
さも本当らしく嘘をつく
He tells circumstantial lies.
さも本気で言うらしい
He talks just as if he were in earnest.
さもあるべし
It ought to be so―That is as it should be―That's only right and proper―That's quite proper and as it should be―It is quite natural that it should be so―(It is) no wonder (that it should be so).
彼としてはさもあるべきことだ
That is only natural with him.
さもありそうな事だ
That may well be―That is very likely.

content:
さもあらばあれ〔遮莫〕
〈副〉However that may be; be that as it may

content.content: 霜満軍営
Bleak appears the silent camp,
秋気清
And clear the autumn sky;
数行過雁
Fights of geese wing southward way,
月三更
The midnight moon is high.
越山併得
I see beside my native heights
能州景
The rugged Noto's shores―
遮莫家郷
Howe'er that be, my folk at home
憶遠征
Must for my welfare sigh.

さもあるべし〔さもある可し〕
〈熟語〉It ought to be so; That is as it should be; That's only right and proper; That's quite proper and as it should be; It is quite natural that it should be so; (It is) no wonder (that it should be so)

content:
さもしい
〈形〉Mean; base; low

content.content: さもしい心を起こす
to obey a base impulse
さもしい根性を出す
to act from low motives
いくら貧乏をしてもそんなさもしい根性は出しませんや
Poor as I am, I am above such meanness.

content:
ざもち〔座持ち〕
〈名〉Keeping the company amused

content.content: 彼は座持ちが上手だ
He keeps the company amused―sets the table in a roar.

ざもと〔座元〕
〈名〉The proprietor of a theatre

content:
さもない〔左もない〕
〈形〉Trifling (thing); trivial (matter); petty (faults, etc.)

content.content: 彼はさもないことで立腹する
He will take offence at trifles.

content:
さもないと
〈接続詞〉→『

content.content: さもなくば

content:
さもなくば
〈接続詞〉Or; else; or else; otherwise

content.content: 勉強なさい、さもなくば失敗するぞ
Persevere, or you will fail.
彼は来られなかったに違いない、さもなくばきっと来たのだ
He must have been unable to come, otherwise he must have come.
彼は勉強家に違いない、さもなくばあのように成功はせぬ
He must be a hard-working man, else―or else―he would not be so successful.
必要ならば格別、さもなくば買うことはない
You need not buy it, unless it be necessary.

content:
さや〔鞘〕
〈名〉
1. A sheath; a scabbard:(小刀などの鞘)a case:(日本筆の鞘)a shield:(万年筆の鞘)a cap

content.content: 刀の鞘を払う
to unsheathe a sword―draw a sword
刀を鞘に収める
to return a sword to its scabbard―put the sword back into the sheath―sheathe a sword―put up a blade
刀が鞘に収まっている
A sword sleeps in its scabbard.
離縁された女房が元の鞘に収まる
A divorced wife is reinstated―taken back to one's bosom.
元の鞘に収める
to reinstate a divorced wife―take her back to one's bosom
鞘付き小刀
a case-knife

content: 2. ［取引所用語］(=売買価の差)a margin

content.content: 大鞘、小鞘
a wide margin―a narrow margin
大鞘値段、小鞘値段
a wide price―a close price

content:
さや〔莢〕
〈名〉A pod; a legume; a shell

content.content: 莢豆
a legume―a legumen
莢豌豆
peas in pods
豌豆の莢
a pea-pod―a peascod
豌豆の莢をむく
to shell peas

content:
さやあて〔鞘当て〕
〈名〉
1. A striking together of scabbards in passing by each other (a breach of etiquette)

content.content: 武士の鞘当て挨拶さっしゃい
This is a breach of etiquette on your part. You owe me an apology.

content: 2. (=恋の仇敵)rivalry in love

content.content: 吉原通いをする連中には往々鞘当てがあったものだ
Rivalry in love used to be frequent occurrence among the frequenters of the gay quarters.

content:
さやえんどう〔莢豌豆〕
〈名〉Peas in pods

content.content: 莢豌豆の莢
a pea-pod―a peascod
莢豌豆の莢をむく
to shell peas

content:
さやか
〈形〉Clear; bright; distinct:(=に) clearly; brightly; distinctly

content.content: さやかに見える
to be clearly visible
さやかに聞こえる
