彼は去って復帰らず
He is gone, never to return―He is gone for good (and all).
光陰去って復帰らず
Time, once past, never returns.
憤然として去る、憤然席を蹴って去る
He flung from his companion―He flung away in a rage.
(またと来ぬ決心で)足の塵を払って去る
to shake the dust off one's feet
秋去って冬来たる
Autumn gives place to winter.
国を去る
to leave home
国を去ってここに十年
It is ten years since I left home.
世を去る
to depart the this life―go out of the world
職を去る
to resign one's post―retire from one's office
王位を去る
to abdicate the throne
幽霊の執着去らず
The ghost haunts the house.
その考えが念頭を去らぬ
The idea haunts my mind.
怖い出来事が記憶を去らぬ
The horrible event haunts my memory.

content:
〈他動〉
1. (=除去する)to remove (obstacles); to eliminate (chance); to get rid of (trouble); to take off (superfluities); to take away (obstacles); to make away with (a person who stands in the way, etc.)

content.content: 原因を去る
to remove the cause
邪魔物を去る
to take away an obstacle―remove an obstacle
邪魔になる者を去らねばならぬ
We must make away with those who stand in the way.
分数を去る
to get rid of fractions
材木の心を去る
to remove the centre of wood
虚栄心を去れ
Rise above vanity!

content: 2. (=離縁する)to divorce (a wife)

content.content: 三年にして子無きは去る
A wife who is childless after three years of marriage should be divorced.

content: 〈形〉(=先の)last

content.content: 去る日曜
last Sunday
新規則は去る四月より実施になった
The new regulations came into effect last April―in April last.
会は去る十日にあった
The meeting was held on the 10th inst.

content: 〈副〉(=今を去る)ago; since; back

content.content: 今を去る五年前にありしことだ
It happened five years age―five years since―five years back.

content:
さる〔距る〕
〈他動〉To be distant from (a place); to be removed from (a state or condition)

content.content: その島は我が国を距る一千マイル
The island lies 1,000 miles (distant) from Japan.
塩釜は仙台を距る東五里
Shiogama lies five ri east of Sendai.
学校を距る五六町のところに火事があった
A fire occurred at a distance of five or six blocks from the school.
彼と相距ること只一歩
We stood only a step from each other.
彼らは獣類と相距ること遠からず
They are not many degrees removed from the brute.
彼らの境遇は奴隷を距ること遠からず
Their condition is not much removed from slavery―little short of slavery.

content:
さる〔然る〕
〈形〉
1. (=かかる)such

content.content: さる事の有りしやもはかられず
Some such thing may have happened.

content: 2. (=ある)a certain

content.content: さる人に聞いた
A certain person told me―A little bird whispered to me.

content: 3. (=もっともな)reasonable

content.content: それもさる事ながら拙者には拙者の考えがござる
What you say is all very well, but I have my own views about it.

さるおがせ〔松蘿〕
〈名〉A kind of tree-moss

さるがく〔猿楽〕
〈名〉An ancient drama (predecessor of the No drama)

さるがしこい〔猿賢い〕
〈形〉Cunning

content:
さるぐつわ〔猿轡〕
〈名〉A gag

content.content: 猿ぐつわをはめる
to gag one

ざるご〔笊碁〕
〈名〉A poor hand at the game of go

さるしばい〔猿芝居〕
〈名〉A monkey performance

さるすべり〔百日紅〕
〈名〉The crape-myrtle

さるぢえ〔猿智慧〕
〈名〉Shallow cunning

さるのこしかけ〔猿の腰掛〕
〈名〉The monkey's stool (a kind of hard mushroom growing on trees)

さるほどに〔然る程に〕
〈副〉It came to pass that...

さるまた〔猿股〕
〈名〉Short drawers; bathing-drawers

さるまわし〔猿廻し〕
〈名〉A monkey-leader

content:
さるもの〔然る者〕
〈名〉Quite a character; no common being

content.content: 敵はさる者
We have no common enemy to deal with.
彼もさる者、なかなか負けてはいない
He is quite a character, and not easily to be put down.
彼もさる者だからやり通すであろう
He is a character in his way, and will put the matter through.

content:
ざるをえぬ〔ざるを得ぬ〕
〈接尾動詞〉Can not but, can not choose but (do something); can not help, can not avoid, can not forbear (doing something)

content.content: 笑わざるを得ぬ
I can not but laugh―can not help laughing―can not keep from laughter.
泣かざるを得ず
I can not but cry―can not help crying―can not refrain from tears.
泣かざるを得んや
How can I choose but cry?―How can I help crying?―What else can I do?

されこうべ〔髑髏〕
〈名〉A skull; a death's-head

ざれごと〔戯言〕
〈名〉A joke; a jest

content:
されば
〈副〉Such being the case; in that case; then; thus; therefore

content.content: さればお待ちを願うよりほかはござらぬ
Such being the case,―Under the circumstances,―I must beg you to wait.
されば拙者自ら参ろう
In that case―Then―I will go myself.
されば教育ほど大事なものはござらぬ
Thus―Therefore―nothing can be more important than education.
さればこそ大事にするのでござる
That's why I make so much of it.
さればと言って
and yet―nevertheless
さればとて人を雇うほどのことでもない
And yet I would not go to the trouble of engaging a man for the purpose.

content:
さればにや
〈副〉That must be the reason why...

content.content: さればにや、かくも秘蔵せらるるならん
That must be the reason why it is so much treasured.

さわ〔沢〕
〈名〉A marsh; a swamp; a bog; a morass

さわかい〔茶話会〕
〈名〉A tea-party

content:
さわがしい〔騒がしい〕
〈形〉
1. (=騒々しい)noisy (crowd); boisterous (wind); clamorous (voices); vociferous (shouting); uproarious (revellers, etc.)

content.content: 教室が騒がしい
The class-room is noisy.
騒がしいと気が散る
Noise distracts the attention.
風が騒がしくて寝られなかった
The boisterous wind kept me awake.
議論百出騒がしい会合であった
It was a clamorous meeting―a stormy assembly.
騒がしい論判が始まっておった
A vociferous dispute was going on.
騒がしい酒盛をして夜を明かした
The night was passed in uproarious revelry.
世間が騒がしい
The town is in an uproar.

content: 2. (=穏かならぬ)turbulent (times); tumultuous (crowd); agitated (country); troubled (times); troublous (times); disturbed (country); alarmed (people); excited (people); exciting (scene); stirring (times); riotous (crowd, etc.)

content.content: 世間が騒がしい
The people are excited―alarmed―in alarm.
天下が騒がしい
The country is disturbed―agitated.
あの頃は騒がしい世に中だった
Those were turbulent times―tumultuous times―stirring times―troublous times.
人が集まって騒がしい
There is a riotous crowd―a tumultuous crowd.
火事場のように騒がしい
It is an exciting scene.

content:
さわがす〔騒がす〕
〈他動〉To alarm (the people), to excite (men); to agitate (the country); to disturb (society); to perturb (one's mind); to stir (the town, etc.)

content.content: 人心を騒がす
to alarm the people―excite the people
戦争の噂が人心を騒がした
The rumour of war alarmed the people.
朦朧政治家が人心を騒がして煽動する
A demagogue will excite the people.
世間を騒がす
to create a sensation―make a stir―raise a storm―occasion a public controversy―make trouble
この疑獄が一時世間を騒がした
The scandal created a sensation for a time.
動物園の獅子が東京を騒がした
The lion made a stir in town.
涜職{とくしょく}事件が世を騒がした
The corruption case raised a storm.
シベリア出兵問題が世間を騒がした
The question of Japan's expedition to Siberia gave rise to a public controversy.
家の中を騒がす
to make a row―kick up a row―make a racket―raise a racket―kick up a racket―make a rumpus―raise a rumpus―kick up a rumpus―kick up a shindy―in the house
彼は家の中を騒がして済まないと言って謝った
He apologized for kicking up such a row in the house.
近所を騒がす
to disturb the neighbourhood―raise a storm in a tea-cup
(火事を出して)近所を騒がしたお詫びに隣人を訪問した
I called on my neighbours to apologize for having disturbed the neighbourhood.

content:
さわぎ〔騒ぎ〕
〈名〉
1. (=喧騒)noise; clamour; outcry; uproar; din; hue and cry

content.content: 割れるような騒ぎだ
There is a hell of a noise.
議場は満堂鼎の沸くが如き騒ぎだった
The House was in an uproar.
大騒ぎをする
to make an uproar―raise a clamour―raise an outcry―raise a hue and cry―cry blue murder
子どもがいなくなって大騒ぎをした
We raised a hue and cry over the lost child.
大騒ぎをして迷子を捜した
We searched for the lost child with hue and cry.
騒ぎが大きい
They raise a great outcry about trifles.

content: 2. (=騒動)disturbance; agitation; commotion; excitement; trouble; ado; bustle; a fuss; a tumult; a turmoil; a hubbub; a hurly-burly; a row; a racket; a rumpus; a shindy

content.content: 騒ぎを起こす
to make a disturbance―create a disturbance―raise a disturbance―make a row―kick up a row―make a racket―raise a racket―kick up a racket―make a rumpus―raise a rumpus―kick up a rumpus―kick up a shindy
大騒ぎをする
to make a fuss―make much ado
つまらないことで大騒ぎをしている(大山鳴動して鼠一匹)
They are making a fuss about trifles―making much ado about nothing.
金が無くなったとてそんな大騒ぎをする必要は無い
There is no need of making such a fuss over the loss of money.
ペストで大騒ぎをした
The pest caused a great excitement.
試験問題が漏れて大騒ぎになった
The divulgence of examination-papers gave rise to great trouble.
戦争のような騒ぎが始まっている
There is a hubbub going on.
家の中は上を下への大騒ぎ、ひっくり返るような騒ぎ
The house is in a great bustle―in a turmoil―being turned upside down―topsyturvy.
(医者を呼びにやるやら)大変な騒ぎだ
There is much ado about it―They are making a fuss about it.
騒ぎを静める
to calm the disturbance―“pour oil on the troubled waters”
騒ぎを大きくする
to increase the excitement―“add fuel to the fire”―“pour oil on the fire”
お祭り騒ぎ
pageantry
血濡れ騒ぎ
bloodshed

content: 3. (=騒がしい酒盛り)noisy revelry; merry-making; high jinks:(一回なら)a noisy frolic; a revel; a riot

content.content: 飲めや歌えやの大騒ぎ、底抜け騒ぎ
a racket―a spree―a riot―high jinks
底抜け騒ぎをする
to go on a racket―go on the spree―paint the sky red
ひと騒ぎやろうじゃないか
Let us have a frolic!

content:
4. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 暑いかって暑いどころの騒ぎじゃない
Hot? It's no name for it.
忙しくって焼餅どころの騒ぎじゃない
I am so busy that I have no time for jealousy.
金が無いからぜいたくどころの騒ぎじゃない
I have no money for luxuries.
それどころの騒ぎじゃない(大事なことがほかにある)
That is a minor matter.
彼は女どもに大騒ぎをされる
He is made much of―much run after―much sought after―by the girls.

content:
さわぎたつ〔騒ぎ立つ〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: さわぎたてる〔騒ぎ立てる〕

content:
さわぎたてる〔騒ぎ立てる〕
〈自動〉To raise a clamour; to make an uproar; to make an outcry; to set up a cry; to raise a hue and cry; to make a fuss; to make much ado

content.content: 彼はつまらぬことを騒ぎ立てる
He raises a hue and cry about trifles―makes a fuss about trifles―makes much ado about nothing.
いたずらに騒ぎ立てる
to bark at the moon―cry blue murder
人にうるさく騒ぎ立てられる
to bring a hornets' nest about one's ears

content:
さわぎまわる〔騒ぎ廻る〕
〈自動〉To bustle about; to hurry about; to fidget about

content.content: 彼は人数をまとめるために騒ぎまわっている
He is bustling about―on the move―on the run―to make up a party.
主人は若旦那にお嫁さんを貰うので朝から騒ぎまわっている
The master of the house has been fidgeting about all day in expectation of his son's bride.

content:
さわぐ〔騒ぐ〕
〈自動〉
1. (=わいわい騒ぐ)to clamour; to raise a clamour; to make a noise; to set up a cry; to make an outcry; to raise a hue and cry; to make an uproar

content.content: 生徒がたいそう騒いでいる
The boys are making a great noise.
騒ぐな
Don't make such a noise!
職工が賃銀値上げで騒いでいる
The men are clamouring for higher wages.
全市大いに騒ぐ
The whole city was in an uproar.
ただあれよあれよと騒ぐばかり
They could only cry out in alarm.
労働者が資本家攻撃で騒いでいる
The labourers are making an outcry against the capitalists―raising a hue and cry against the capitalists.
議会は内閣攻撃で騒いでいる
The Diet is making things lively for the Cabinet.

content: 2. (=気が騒ぐ)to be alarmed; to be excited; to be disturbed; to be perturbed; to be agitated; to be fluttered

content.content: 世間は戦争の噂で騒いでいる
The people are alarmed at the rumour of war.
大国民は些細なことで騒がぬ
A great people is not alarmed at trifles.
騒ぐに及ばぬ、騒ぐ必要はない
You need not be alarmed―There is no cause for alarm.
火事で近所が騒いだ
The fire alarmed the neighbourhood―excited the neighbourhood.
胸が騒ぐ
I am agitated―fluttered―in a flutter of excitement.
彼はどんなことがあっても騒がぬ
Nothing can disturb him―He is imperturbable.
騒がずにものが言えないか
Can't you speak without excitement?―without agitation?―more calmly?
彼は少しも騒がず答弁した
He answered without the least excitement―without the least agitation―with perfect composure.

content: 3. (=どさくさ騒ぐ、騒ぎ立てる)to bustle; to make a fuss; to make much ado

content.content: 家の中はどさくさ騒いでいる
The house is in a bustle―in a turmoil.
上を下へと騒いでいる、ひっくり返るように騒いでいる
The house is topsyturvy―being turned upside down.
つまらぬことで騒ぐな
Don't make a fuss about trifles―Don't make much ado about nothing.
人にうるさく騒がれる
to raise a hornets' nest about one's ears

content: 4. (=どんちゃん騒ぐ)to revel; to riot; to make merry; to hold high jinks; to go on a racket; to go on the spree:(米国にては) to paint the sky red

content.content: 酒を飲んで騒いでいる
They are revelling―rioting―making merry.
飲めや歌えやで騒いでいる、どんちゃん騒いでいる
They are singing and dancing and making merry―holding high jinks―having a racket―on the spree―(米国では)―painting the sky red―painting the town red.
羽目をはずして騒いでいる
They are having a gay frolic―having a boisterous merry-making.
芸者を揚げて騒いだ
We had a geisha spree.
船乗りは上陸して騒ぐのをなにより楽しみにしている
Sailors look forward to making merry on shore.

content: 5. (=暴れて騒ぐ)to riot; to run riot; to make ［kick up］a row; to make ［raise, kick up］a racket; to make ［raise, kick up］a rumpus; to kick up a shindy

content.content: 表では弥次馬が騒いでいる
The mob is running riot in the streets.
彼は酒に酔って帰って来ては乱暴して騒ぐ
He will come home drunk, and kick up a row―kick up a racket―kick up a shindy.

content: 6. (=騒ぎ廻る)to bustle about; to hurry about; to fidget about

content.content: 彼は会社を起こすとて騒いでいる
He is bustling about―on the move―on the run―to float a company.
うちの主人は若旦那に嫁を貰うので朝から騒いでいる
Our master has been fidgeting about all day in expectation of his son's bride.

content: 7. (=動乱する、動揺する)to be disturbed; to be agitated; to be in agitation; to be in commotion

content.content: 天下大いに騒ぐ
The whole country was greatly disturbed―in great agitation―in a hubbub.
社会が騒ぎ出した
Society shows signs of commotion.

content:
さわさわ
〈擬音詞〉
1. Rustle (the sound of rustling)

content.content: 茅{かや}が風にさわさわする
The reeds rustle in the wind―The wind rustles through the reeds.
そわそわする

ざわざわする〔ザワザワする〕
〈自動〉To be noisy; to be in commotion

ざわざわする〔ザワザワする〕
〈自動〉To be noisy; to be in commotion

さわす〔醂す〕
〈他動〉To sweeten (astringent persimmons)

ざわつく〔騒つく〕
〈自動〉To be noisy; to be in commotion

ざわめく〔騒めく〕
〈自動〉To be noisy; to be in commotion

content:
さわやか〔爽か〕
〈形〉
1. (=爽快な)fresh, refreshing, soothing (feeling); balmy (air)

content.content: 気分が爽やかになった
I feel refreshed.
タバコを飲むと心持が爽やかになる
Tobacco is soothing.
吹く風も身に爽やかなり
The air is balmy.
爽やかな天気だ
The weather is refreshing―It is refreshing weather.

content: 2. (=はっきりした)clear; distinct

content.content: 爽やかな声
a clear voice―a clarion voice
弁舌爽やか
eloquent―fluent
彼は弁舌爽やかに述べた
He spoke with eloquence.
爽やかな弁舌
an eloquent tongue―a fluent tongue
弁舌爽やかな人
an eloquent man―a fluent speaker

さわら〔花柏〕
〈名〉A kind of cypress

さわら〔鰆〕
〈名〉A kind of scombroid fish

さわらび〔早蕨〕
〈名〉A young bracken; a bracken shoot

content:
さわり〔障り〕
〈名〉
1. (=故障、妨害)hindrance; impediment; interference

content.content: 事がなんの障りも無く運んだ
The matter proceeded without let or hindrance.
遊びが勉強の障りにならぬよう
Your studies must not interfere with your studies.

content: 2. (=影響)affection

content.content: これくらいのキズがあっても品物の価には障りにならぬ
Such a blemish does not affect the value of the article.

content: 3. (=害)harm; injury; damage

content.content: 嵐が作物の障りになる
The storm will do harm to―do damage to―the crops.
地震で障りは無いか
Has the earthquake done you no harm?―Have you sustained no injury from the earthquake?
なんの障りも無い
We are all right.
時候の障りだ
I am under the weather.
暑さの障りだ
I am suffering from the effects of the heat―I have a heat-stroke.
子どもはなんの障りも無く成長する
The child is growing up in perfect health.

content: 4. (=月経)the menses; the courses; the periods; the flowers

content.content: 婦人はからだに障りがある
She is not well.

content:
さわり〔触り〕
〈名〉
1. (=手触り)touch; feel

content.content: 絹は触りが好い
Silk feels soft and smooth―It is pleasant to the feel―It is pleasant to the touch.

content: 2. (=義太夫の触り)an impassioned passage (in the Gidayu)

さわる〔障る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=妨げる)to interfere with (anything)

content.content: 遊ぶのもよいが勉強に障らぬように遊べ
Your pleasures must not interfere with your studies.

content: 2. (=影響する)to affect

content.content: これくらいのキズがあっても品物の価には障らぬ
Such a blemish will not affect the value of the article.
そんなことをすると名に障る
Such conduct will affect your reputation―Your reputation will suffer from such conduct.

content: 3. (=害する)to injure; to harm; to hurt

content.content: 身体{からだ}に障る
to do one harm―injure one's health―impair one's health―to be bad for the health―injurious to health―detrimental to health
あまり酒を飲むとからだに障る
Too much wine will do you harm.
勉強が過ぎるとからだに障る
Overwork will impair your health―Overwork is injurious to health.
光線があまり強いと目に障る
Too strong light hurts the eye.
何かお目に障りましたか(お目障り)
Has anything offended your eye?―Is there anything offensive to the eye?
彼の声は耳に障る
His voice grates on the ear―jars on the ear―He has a discordant voice―a dissonant voice.
あの男の挙動が神経に障る
His behaviour affects my nerves―jars on my nerves.
気に障る
to hurt one's feelings―offend one―give offence
お気に障って済まなかった
I am sorry to have hurt your feelings.
人の気に障ることを言うものでない
You should not make offensive remarks.
君は口が悪いから人の気に障るのだ
Your tongue gives offence.
癪に障る
to displease one―irritate one―provoke one―aggravate one―exasperate one―sting one to the quick
癪に障った
I was stung to the quick.
彼の言いぐさが癪に障った
His words stung me to the quick.
癪に障ることを言う男だ
He makes cutting remarks.
癪に障ることをする男だ
His behaviour is aggravating.
些細なことが癪に障る
Trifles irritate me―I am irritated by trifles.
陽気が障ったのだ
I am under the weather.
暑気が障ったのだ
I am suffering from the effects of the heat―I have a heat-stroke.
婦人はからだが障っている
She is not well.

content:
さわる〔触る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=触れる)to touch; to feel

content.content: 手探りに探ると手に触った物がある
I groped about and touched something.
腕に触ったものがある
Something touched me on the arm.
蚕は触ると気味の悪い物だ
Silkworms are horrible things to touch.
品物に触ることお断り

〈名〉Three states of existence (the past, the present and the future)

content.content: 主従は三世
The relation between master and servant holds good for three existences.

さんせい〔三省〕
〈名〉Self-examination:(=する) to examine oneself; to reflect on oneself

さんせい〔三聖〕
〈名〉The three sages (Buddha, Confucius, and Christ)

content:
さんせい〔賛成〕
〈名〉Approval; approbation; support; advocacy; endorsement; suffrage:(=する) to approve of (a plan); to support (a bill); to advocate (a cause); to endorse, subscribe to, enter into (one's views); to second (a motion or a proposition); to favour (a scheme); to vote for (a measure); to be for (doing anything); to be in favour of (a scheme); to be behind (a proposal); to take interest in (a project, etc.)

content.content: 両親は縁談に賛成です
My parents approve of the match.
皆僕の計画に賛成している
Everybody approves of my plan―favours my scheme―looks on my project with favour.
君はこの計画にご賛成でしょうね
I hope you approve of the plan―favour the scheme―I hope the plan meets your approval.
賛成を得る
to meet with one's approval―meet one's approbation
満堂の賛成を得る
to meet with universal approval
事業は有力家の賛成を得た
The enterprise has met the approval of influential men―gained favour with influential men.
世間の賛成を得る
to obtain the world's suffrage
賛成の意を表す
to express one's approval―express one's approbation
彼は微笑して賛成の意を表した
He smiled his approval.
点頭{うなづ}いて賛成の意を表した
He nodded his approval.
賛成の意を漏らしながら(傍観しておった)
He looked on approvingly.
君の意見に賛成はできぬ
I can not endorse your views―subscribe to your views.
しかし皆僕の意見に賛成している
But everybody enters into my views.
議長、その動議に賛成です
Mr. Chairman, I second the motion.
僕の発議にご賛成あらんことを希望します
I hope you will all second my proposition.
議案を賛成する
to support a bill―vote for a measure
甲派が議案に賛成すれば乙派は必ず反対する
If the one party votes for a measure, the other party is sure to vote against it.
どうぞご賛成を願います
I beg you will support me.
戦争に賛成な者もあるし反対な者もある
Some are for war and the others are against it.
僕は戦争に賛成だ
I am for war―in favour of war.
僕はすぐ始める方に賛成だ
I am for beginning at once.
僕は時機を待つ方に賛成だ
I am for biding our time.
僕は休みに賛成だ
I am in favour of a holiday.
休みに賛成な人は手を挙げて
Let those in favour of a holiday show their hands!
賛成、賛成
So say all of us!
この政策に賛成している政治家が多い
Many politicians are in favour of this policy―behind this policy.
あの人は普選に賛成している
He advocates universal suffrage.
この美学に賛成する者が無い
Nobody takes interest in the good work.
新教授法には僕が賛成だ
The new method has my suffrage.
双手を挙げて賛成する
to welcome anything with open arms
事業に人の賛成を求める
to interest one in a project―enlist one in a cause
有力家の賛成を得ようと思って遊説に行った
I called on influential men to interest them in my project.
強いて賛成を求めはせぬ
I do not want to force my views upon you―impose my opinion upon you.
賛成者
a supporter (of a bill)―a seconder (of a motion or a proposition)―an advocate (of a cause)
賛成な人は「アイ」と言って下さい
Let those in favour say aye!
賛成者と反対者
ayes and noes
賛成者と反対者は相半ばしている
The ayes and noes are equally divided.
採決すると一百五十の反対者に対し二百の賛成者があった
On division, there were 200 ayes against 150 noes.
賛成は二百票、反対は百五十票
There are 200 ayes and 150 noes―200 affirmative and 150 negative votes―200 votes in the affirmative and 150 in the negative.
賛成者多数
The ayes have it.
賛成論をする者もあれば反対論をする者もある
They argue for and against the measure―argue pro and con.
種々の賛成論や反対論がある
There are many pros and cons.
彼は決議に賛成の演説をした
He spoke in favour of the resolution―supported the resolution.
賛成演説をする者もあれば反対演説をする者もあった
Some spoke in favour of it, some spoke against it.
賛成の演説
a speech in favour of anything

content:

〈名〉Participation in a war; entry into a war:(=する) to participate in a war; to take part in a war; to enter a war

content.content: イタリアは遂に連合国側に参戦した
Italy finally entered the war on the side of the Allies―threw her weight on the side of the Allies.
米国の参戦無かりせばあるいはドイツの勝利に帰せしやも測り難し
But for America's entry into the war, Germany might possibly have come off victorious.

content:
さんぜん〔産前〕

content.content: 産前産後
before and after childbirth

content:

〈副〉Copiously

content.content: 潜然と泣く
to weep copiously―weep copious tears
一人の女が潜然と泣いておった
A woman was crying bitterly.
潜然として涙下る
to melt into tears―be dissolved in tears

content:

content.content: 嶄然頭角を現す
to make a prominent figure―cut a conspicuous figure

content:
さんぜんせかい〔三千世界〕
〈名〉The universe; the whole world

content.content: 三千世界に一人の君
You are everything to me.
三千世界に子を持った親の心は皆一つ
Universal is parental love.
三千世界の
Throughout the world I'd kill
烏を殺し
The cawing morning crow,
主と朝寝が
And sleep at morn my fill
して見度い
With you as bed-fellow.

content:

content.content: 酸素化合物
an oxygen compound―an oxide

酸素吸入器

content.content: あの山には山賊が出る
The mountain-pass is infested with bandits.

to take to the road

content.content: 残存者
a survivor

content:

〈名〉Three generations; three reigns

content.content: 老婢は三代に仕えている
The old servant has served the family for three generations.
今六十以上の人は三代に仕えている
People in their sixties and over have seen three reigns.

content:
さんだい〔参内〕

content.content: 大臣は参内中だ
The Minister has gone to court―He is at court.
大使は帰朝するや否や参内せり
The ambassador proceeded to the Imperial Palace immediately on his return from abroad.

content:
ざんだか〔残高〕
〈名〉The remainder; the balance

content.content: 差引残高
The balance
残高を後期へ繰越す
The balance is carried forward to the next account.
繰越残高
the balance carried over
残高勘定
balance account
残高表
a balance sheet

〈名〉Usurpation:(=する) to usurp

content.content: 王位を纂奪する
to usurp the throne
纂奪者
a usurper

content:
さんだゆう〔三太夫〕
〈名〉A house-steward; a factotum; a major-domo

content.content: 彼はあの家のまあ三太夫さ
He is a sort of major-domo to the family.

content:
さんたん〔三嘆〕
〈名〉Deep admiration:(=する) to be filled with deep admiration

content.content: 一読三嘆する
to read with deep admiration

content:
さんたん〔惨憺〕
〈形〉
1. Pitiful; pitiable; piteous; deplorable; miserable; wretched; horrible; tragic; dire

content.content: 罹災者は実に惨憺たるものだ
The sufferers are in a wretched plight―in the direst misery.
被害地は惨憺たる光景を呈している
The districts affected present a deplorable spectacle.
惨事の現場は惨憺たる光景を呈している
The scene of disaster presents a horrible spectacle.
親しく革命の惨憺たる光景を目撃した
I have witnessed the horrors of a revolution.
現代の戦場はその惨憺たる言語に絶す
The scene of modern warfare presents a spectacle of unspeakable horrors.
フランスの戦場はその荒廃の状惨憺たるものであった
The battle-area of France was in a horrible state of devastation.
近頃の暴風雨でうちの庭木は実に惨憺たるものだ
The late storm has played havoc among―wrought havoc with―my garden-shrubs.
くしんさんたん〔苦心惨憺〕
経営惨憺十年にして事業を完成せり
He completed his work after ten years of labour.

content:
さんたん〔讃嘆〕
〈名〉Admiration:(=する) to admire

content.content: 讃嘆措くあたわず
I am filled with admiration―lost in admiration.

content:
さんだん〔算段〕
〈名〉Contrivance; management:(=する) to contrive; to manage; to make shift; to devise means; to raise (money); to make out, make up (a sum)

content.content: 金の算段がつかない
I can not raise the money―raise the dust―raise the wind.
要るだけどうか算段してみよう
I will make up the required sum―make out the required sum.
(そのことか)どうか算段してみよう
I will try and manage it―contrive to do it―make shift to do it―devise some means to do it.
着物はどう算段しようか
What shall I do for the clothes?
着物はどうか算段しよう
I will manage to find the clothes―contrive to find the clothes―make shift to find the clothes.
無理算段する
to strain one's credit
無理算段をして百円だけこしらえた
I have strained my credit to the extent of 100 yen.
そんな品があったらどんな無理算段をしても買う
I will go any length―go all lengths―to buy such an article.
あの女はやりくり算段がうまい
She is good at cutting and contriving.

content:

〈名〉Shot

content.content: 火薬と霰弾
powder and shot
霰弾銃
a shot-gun

content.content: 省略三段論法

A centimetre is one hundredth of a metre.

content:
さんち〔珊<サンチ>〕
〈名〉(=センチ)A centimetre

content.content: 一サンチは一メートルの百分の一
A centimetre is one hundredth of a metre.

content:
さんち〔産地〕
〈名〉The place of production; the habitat, the home (of an animal or a plant):(複合詞に用いれば)a... country; a... field

content.content: 米の産地は肥後をもって第一とす
Higo is considered the best place for rice.
信濃は生糸の産地だ
Shinano is a silk-producing district―a silk-country.
マニラはタバコの産地だ
The Philippines are a tobacco-country.
南阿には金剛石の産地がある
There is a diamond-field in South Africa.
日本には石炭の産地が多い
There are many coal-fields in Japan.
キリンの産地はアフリカである
Africa is the home of the giraffe.

content:

〈名〉Arrival:(=する) to arrive

content.content: 参着払い
sight payment―(の)―payable at sight
参着払手形
a bill payable at sight―a sight bill―a bill on demand―a bill on presentation
参着相場
sight rate

content:
さんちゅう〔山中〕
〈副〉Among the mountains

content.content: 山中暦日無し
The mountains have no almanac.

content:
さんちょう〔山頂〕
〈名〉The summit of a mountain

content.content: 雪を戴ける山頂
the snow-capt heights of a mountain

〈名〉An estimate:(=する) to estimate

content.content: 算定価格
estimated value

estimated tare

content:
ざんてい〔暫定〕
〈形〉Provisional

content.content: 暫定則
a provisional rule

content:
さんど〔三度〕
〈副〉Three times; thrice

content.content: 彼に逢うのはこれで三度目だ
This is the third time that I have met him―I have met him for the third time.
両三度
twice or thrice―two or three times
三度に一度は
once in three times

content:
さんとう〔三等〕
〈名〉The third class:(形容詞に用いれば)third-class; third-rate

content.content: 僕は三等に乗る
I travel third class.
三等客
a third-class passenger―(船なら)―a steerage passenger
三等国
a third-rate power
三等親
a relation of the third degree

content:
さんどう〔参堂〕
〈名〉(Honorific for) a visit:(=する) to visit, call on, wait on (one)

content.content: 明日参堂可仕候
I shall (do myself the honour to) wait on you tomorrow.

content:
さんどう〔参道〕

content.content: 明治神宮参道
the approach to the Meiji Shrine

content:
さんどう〔賛同〕
〈名〉Approval; consent:(=する) to approve of (a plan); to consent to (a plan); to endorse (one's views); to subscribe to (one's views); to fall in with (one's views)

content.content: 何卒此計画に御賛同被下度候
I hope you will approve of the plan―consent to the plan.
この計画について彼の賛同を求めた
I have asked his approval of the plan.
この計画は彼の賛同を得ている
The plan has met with his approval―The plan has his approval―I have obtained his consent to the plan.
君の意見に賛同することはできない
I can not fall in with your views―subscribe to your views―endorse your views.

to gather together the remnants of a defeated army
頼朝が旗を揚げると源氏の残党その旗に集まる
When Yoritomo raised his standard, the remnants of Genji forces flocked to his banner.

content.content: 雑費は勘定に算入してある
The expenses are included in the account.

content:
ざんにゅうする〔竄入する〕
〈自動〉
1. (=逃げ込む)to take refuge (in a place)

content.content: 竄入軍艦
a fugitive warship

content: 2. (=間違ったところへ入り込む)to get into the wrong place

さんにん〔三人〕
〈名〉Three persons

content.content: 三人がかりで仕事をやってしまった
We have finished the work among us three.
我々三人で百円出そう
Let us give 100 yen among us three.
三人旅をするな
“Three is not company.”
三人寄れば文珠の智慧
“Two heads are better than one.”
三人組
a trio―a triumvirate

content:
ざんにん〔残忍〕
〈形〉Cruel; brutal; hard-hearted; cold-blooded; merciless; pitiless; heartless; ruthless; inhuman

content.content: 残忍な人だ
He is a brutal man―a hard-hearted man―a cold-blooded man―a brute.
残忍な心だ
He has a merciless heart―a pitiless-heart―a ruthless heart.
残忍性を発揮している
He shows his brutal nature―brutality.
残忍非道
inhuman
残忍刻薄
atrocious

ざんにんき〔残任期〕
〈名〉The remainder of one's term of office

content:
さんぬる〔去ぬる〕
〈形〉Last

content.content: 去ぬる年
last year

content:
さんねん〔三年〕
〈名〉Three years:(=の) triennial

content.content: 第三年
the third year
三年級
the Third Year Class
三年生
a third year student
三年生植物
a triennial
三年飛ばず鳴かず
I lie fallow for three years.
三年経てば三つになる
It is the course of nature―It is the power of time―Time works wonders.
石の上にも三年
Perseverance will not fail of its reward.
福得の三年目
It is a godsend―a windfall.
岡惚れ三年色のうち
Three years of unrequited love will entitle one to be loved.

content:
ざんねん〔残念〕
〈名〉
1. (=遺憾)regret; repentance; disappointment:(=がる) to regret; to repent (of something); to be disappointed (at something); to be sorry:(=な) regrettable; disappointing

content.content: 残念だ
I am sorry―It is a pity.
その人に逢わないで残念なことをした
I am sorry I did not meet him.
若い時に勉強しなかったのが残念です
I am sorry I was idle when young―I repent of my past idleness.
彼は若い時に勉強しなかったのを残念がっている
He repents of his past idleness.
せっかく始めた学問を止めるのは実に残念です
I am very sorry that I must give up my studies while I have only just begun.
君が来ないので残念だった
I was disappointed at your absence.
いかにも残念だ
It is very much to be regretted―It is a great pity.
今日天気の悪いのはいかにも残念だ
It is a pity the weather is bad―I regret the badness of the weather.
子どもが男でなかったのはいかにも残念です
It is a great pity―a thousand pities―that the child is not a boy.
男だとばかり思っていたからなおさら残念です
I expected a boy, more's the pity.
彼が失敗したのはいかにも残念だ
It is a great pity―deeply to be regretted―that he has failed.
あの若さで死んだのは返す返すも残念だ
It is never enough to be regretted that he died so young.
いくら残念がってもしかたがない
Regrets will not mend matters.
残念ながら
I am sorry to say―I regret to say―to my regret.
彼は残念ながらまた落第です
He has, I am sorry to say, failed again.
残念ながらご依頼に応じかねます
I regret to say that I am not in a position to comply with your request.
残念ながら彼に会う機会を得なかった
To my regret, I could not get at him.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 僕は金持ちになればなれたのだに残念なことをした
I might have been a rich man.
そうすればそうなるのだったに残念なことをした
It might have been so.

content: 2. (=無念)vexation; mortification; chagrin:(=がる) to be vexed, be mortified, be chagrined (at something)

content.content: 失敗して残念だ
I am vexed at my failure―mortified at my failure―chagrined at my failure.
彼は負けて残念がっている
He is vexed―mortified―chagrined―at his defeat.
彼は地団太踏んで残念がった
He stamped with vexation.
彼は舌打ちして残念がった
“Tut! tut!” he exclaimed with vexation.
残念ながら逃してしまった
He has escaped me to my vexation.
(敵弾などを受けて)残念(!)
Zounds!

content:
さんば〔産婆〕
〈名〉A midwife; a maternity-nurse; a wise woman; an accoucheuse

content.content: 産婆の役をする
to assist at the birth―attend a childbirth
新内閣の産婆役をする
to assist at the birth of a new Cabinet
産婆術
midwifery―obstetrics

content:
さんばい〔三倍〕
〈副〉Three times; thrice:(=の) treble:(=する) to treble; to multiply by three

content.content: 甲の大きさは乙の三倍ある
A is three times as large as―three times the size of―B.
甲の財産は乙の三倍ある
A is worth three times as much as B.
物価は三倍に騰貴した
The prices have trebled.

content:
さんぱい〔三拝〕
〈名〉Bowing three times

content.content: 三拝九拝しろ
Beg pardon on your knees!

content:
さんぱい〔参拝〕
〈名〉Worship:(=する) to worship at, pray before (a shrine)

content.content: 遺族は参拝を許される
The bereaved families are permitted to worship at the shrine.

content:
さんぱい〔酸敗〕
〈名〉Acidification:(=する) to acidify; to turn sour

content.content: 牛乳が酸敗する
Milk turns sour.
この牛乳は酸敗しかけている
The milk is on the turn.

content:
さんばし〔桟橋〕
〈名〉A pier; a jetty

content.content: 船が桟橋に着く
A ship comes alongside the pier.
船は桟橋につないである

He is awake to his own interests―He has an eye to the main chance.

シェークスピア

content.content: しゃおう〔沙翁〕

content:
しお〔塩〕
〈名〉Salt

content.content: 塩が辛い
There is too much salt in it―It is too salty.
汁は塩が辛い
There is too much salt in the soup―The soup is too salty.
塩が甘い
There is not enough salt in it―it is not salt enough.
この汁は塩が甘い
There is not enough salt in the soup―The soup is not salt enough.
漬物は塩が辛過ぎる
The pickles are too salty.
漬物は塩が甘いと悪くなる
Pickles will go bad if they are not well salted.
この魚は塩が甘いから長く持たぬ
The fish will not keep long, as it is not sufficiently salted.
田舎の料理は塩が辛い
Country dishes have too much salt in them―Country dishes are too salty.
東京の料理は塩が甘い
Tokyo dishes have too little salt in them―Tokyo cooking is sparing of salt.
田舎では塩を辛く煮る
Country people cook with too much salt―Country people are unsparing of salt in cooking.
東京では塩を甘く煮る
Tokyo people cook with too little salt―Tokyo people are sparing of salt in cooking.
野菜を塩につける
to pickle vegetables with salt
野菜の塩漬け
salted vegetables
魚や肉に塩をする
to salt fish―salt meat
塩魚
salted fish
塩豚
salted pork―bacon
肉に塩をつけて食う
to eat meat with salt
(食事中)塩を取って下さい
Pass me the salt.
(食卓用の)塩皿

塩匙
a salt-spoon
塩は腐敗を防ぐ
Salt preserves things from decay.
汝らは世の塩なり(とキリストがその信徒に向かって言った)
“Ye are the salt of the earth.”
塩を振って清める(に相当するは)
to sprinkle ashes over a spot

content:
しお〔潮〕
〈名〉
1. (=潮流)the tide

content.content: 潮が差す、潮が上がる、潮が満ちる
The tide flows.
潮が上げている、潮が差している
The tide in flowing―The tide is on the flow.
潮が差した、潮が満ちている
The tide is at the full―The tide is in―It is high tide―It is high water.
潮が満ちると暗礁が見えぬ
The rocks are invisible at high tide―at high water.
潮が退く、潮が下げる、潮が干る
The tide ebbs―(海岸のことを言えば)―The ebbing tide leaves the beach dry.
潮が下げている、潮が退いている
The tide is ebbing―The tide is on the ebb.
潮が退いた、潮が干いている
The tide is at the ebb―The tide is out―It is low tide―It is low water―(海岸のことを言えば)―The ebbing tide has left the beach dry.
潮が干ると暗礁が見える
The rocks are visible at low tide―at low water.
潮が干きった
It is dead low tide―dead low water.
潮は変り目だ
The tide is turning―The tide in on the turn.
潮の差し退き、潮の満干

上げ潮

下げ潮

大潮

小潮

鯨が潮を吹く

あれ鯨が潮を吹いている
There he spouts!

content:
じかい〔次回〕
〈名〉Next time:(=の) next:(=に) next time

content.content: 次回に譲る
The matter is postponed―put off.

content:
じがい〔自害〕
〈名〉Suicide; self-destruction; felo-de-se:(=する) to commit suicide; to commit felo-de-se; to destroy oneself; to kill oneself; to make away with oneself; to lay violent hands on oneself; to die by one's own hand

content.content: 己が行為を恥じて自害した
Ashamed of his conduct, he committed suicide―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Shame drove him to suicide.
自害を企てる
to attempt one's own life
早まって自害する
to commit a rash act
自害者
a suicide

しかいけいてい〔四海兄弟〕
〈名〉Universal brotherhood

しかいしゃ〔司会者〕
〈名〉The president; the chairman:(宴会なら)the toast-master

しがいせん〔紫外線〕
〈名〉Ultra-violet rays

content:
しかえし〔仕返し〕
〈名〉Tit for tat; retaliation; revenge:(戦争中なら)a reprisal:(=する) to give (one) tit for tat; to retaliate (on one); to take one's revenge; to make a reprisal; to pay (one) in one's own coin; to serve (one) with the same sauce; to get even with (one); to get quits with (one)

content.content: 仕返ししてやったのさ
I only gave him tit for tat.
そんなことをすると仕返しをするぞ
I will pay you in your own coin.
(今度は負けたが)この次に仕返ししてやる
I will have my revenge next time.
(こんなことをしあがったから)きっと仕返ししてみせる
I will be even with him yet―be quits with him yet.
英軍はこの仕返しにドイツの都会に爆弾を投下した
The British made a reprisal by throwing bombs on German towns.

しかえる〔仕替える〕
〈自動〉To do (anything) over again; to make (anything) anew; to start afresh

しかかり〔仕掛り〕
〈名〉Beginning; commencement

しかかる〔仕掛かる〕
〈他動〉To begin, commence (doing something)

content:

〈名〉→『

content.content: せっかく〔刺客〕

content:
しかく〔四角〕
〈名〉A quadrilateral; a square:(=な) square; four-cornered

content.content: 四角な卓
a square table
四角な帽子
a square cap―a four―cornered cap
真四角
a true square
丸い玉子も切りようで四角(物も言いようで角が立つ)
“Smooth words make smooth ways.”→『しかくしめん〔四角四面〕』→『しかくばる〔四角張る〕』

しかく〔視覚〕
〈名〉The sense of sight; eyesight; vision

しかく〔視角〕
〈名〉The visual angle

content:
しかく〔資格〕
〈名〉
1. (=権能)qualification; competence; eligibility:(法律上の資格)legal status; competence; capacity; capability:(権利上の資格)right; title; pretension:(教員などの免許)a licence; a certificate

content.content: 会員の資格が有るか
Are there any qualifications for membership?
彼は会員の資格が有る
He is qualified for membership.
選挙人の資格が有る
There are qualifications for an elector.
君は選挙人の資格が有る
You are qualified for an elector.
議員の資格
eligibility for an M. P
僕は議員の資格が有る
I am eligible for an M. P.
資格有る
qualified―competent―eligible―capable―licenced―certificated
資格無き
disqualified―incompetent―ineligible―incapable―unlicenced―uncertificated
有資格者
a qualified person―a competent person―a licenced person
無資格者
a disqualified person―an incompetent person―an unlicenced person
彼は英語を教える資格が有る
He is qualified for teaching English―competent for teaching English.
英語を教える資格の有る先生は少ない
There are few men competent for teaching English.
充分教える資格が有る
He is fully disqualified for teaching―quite competent for teaching.
教える資格が無い
He is disqualified for teaching―incompetent for teaching.
本校卒業生は無試験にて中学校教員たるの資格が有る
The graduates of our school are qualified for teaching at middle schools free of examination.
資格ある教師
a competent teacher
資格ある教員
a licenced teacher―a certificated teacher
資格ある批評家
a competent critic
資格ある証人
a competent witness
彼は治産の資格が有る、資格が無い
He is capable of managing his property―incapable of managing his property.
僕は無賃乗車の資格が有る
I am entitled to a free pass.
彼は人を批評する資格が無い
He has no right to criticize others.
彼は学者だなどと言う資格は無い
He has no pretension to scholarship.
彼女は美人だなどと言う資格は無い
She has no pretension to beauty.
(彼はよく働くから)給料を取る資格が有る
He is earning his salary―worth his salt.
いま一人の方は飯を食う資格が無い(穀つぶしだ)
He is not worth his salt.
(今日は働いたから)飯を食う資格が有る
I have earned my dinner.

content:
2. 
〈動詞付〉

content.content: 教員の資格を取る
to qualify as a teacher―(許可学校をでるか検定試験を受うけてなら)―take a teacher's licence
資格を与える
to qualify one for something―capacitate one for something
資格を奪う
to disqualify one for or from something―incapacitate one for or from something
資格を失う
to be disqualified for or from something―incapacitated for or from something
彼は選挙法違犯のために候補者たるの資格を失った
He is disqualified for candidature owing to infringement of the election law―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Infringement of the election law has disqualified him for candidature.
資格剥奪、資格喪失
disqualification―incapacitation

content: 3. (=何の資格)capacity

content.content: 彼は家庭教師の資格で主人に随行した
He accompanied his master on his travels in the capacity of tutor―as tutor.
彼は顧問官の資格で列席した
He attended in the capacity of adviser―He was present as adviser.
彼は官吏の資格で来たか
Did he come in his official capacity?
一個人の資格で訪問した
He called in his individual capacity―in a private capacity.
それは裁判官の資格で言ったことではない
He did not say it in his judicial capacity.

content:
4. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 彼はこの役を勤める資格が有る
He is worthy to fill the post.
彼女は彼の連合いになる資格が無い
She is unworthy to be his partner.

content:
しがく〔史学〕
〈名〉History (as a science)

content.content: 史学科
a history course

しがく〔私学〕
〈名〉A private institution for learning; a private school

content:
しがく〔視学〕
〈名〉A school-inspector

content.content: 県視学
a prefectural inspector of schools
市視学
a municipal inspector of schools.
群視学
a district inspector of schools

じかく〔字画〕
〈名〉The number of strokes (in a Chinese character)

じかく〔持格〕
〈名〉The possessive case

content:
じかく〔自覚〕
〈名〉Self-consciousness; self-awakening:(=する) to be conscious of (one's powers) ; to awake to (one's interests)

content.content: 自分の力の足らぬことを自覚している
I am conscious of my want of ability.
この戦争では国民が国力を自覚した
By this war, the nation awoke to its power.―(他動詞構文にすれば)―This war awakened the nation to its power.

content:
しかくしめん〔四角四面〕
〈形〉Stiff, starchy (manner); formal (speech); ceremonious (address); punctilious (manners); prim (person); precise (dress); square-toed (person); strait-laced (moralist, etc.)

content.content: 四角四面な人だ
He is punctilious man―a prim person―a square-toes―a stickler for etiquette―He has a stiff manner―a stiff and formal manner―a starchy manner―punctilious manners.
四角四面な口上を述べる
to make a formal speech―give a ceremonious address
彼の身形{みなり}は四角四面だ
He is precisely dressed.
なんでも四角四面にすることが好きだ
He is a precisian.

content:
しかくばる〔四角張る〕
〈自動〉To be stiff; to be starchy; to be formal; to be prim; to be punctilious; to be ceremonious; to stand on ceremony

content.content: あの人は四角張っている
He has a stiff manner―a stiff and formal manner―a starchy manner―punctilious manners―He is prim―prim and punctilious.
四角張ったものの言いようをする
He has a formal manner of speaking―a ceremonious way of talking.
そう四角張らずもできそうなものだ
You might do it with less ceremony―without ceremony.
僕だからそう四角張ることはない
You need not stand on ceremony with me.

content:
しかけ〔仕掛け〕
〈名〉
1. (=からくり)a device; a contrivance; a mechanism; an appliance; an apparatus; works

content.content: なかなか器用な仕掛けだ
It is a clever device―an ingenious contrivance―an ingenious piece of mechanism.
戸はばね仕掛けになっている
The door works by a spring.
機械仕掛けで動くようになっている
The whole moves by a mechanical device―a mechanical contrivance―a mechanical appliance―a mechanism.
陰に何か仕掛けがある
There is some mechanism behind.
戸がひとりでに開くような仕掛けになっている
The door is so contrived as to open of itself.
この椅子にかけると床が下がる仕掛けになっている
The floors is so contrived as to sink if any one sits down on this chair.
水を揚げる仕掛け
an apparatus for raising water
時計の仕掛け
the works of a watch or a clock
ぜんまい仕掛け
clock―work
危ない仕掛けだ
It is a touch―and―go arrangement―a house of cards.
二人がけんかをする仕掛けにしよう
Let us get up a quarrel!
色仕掛けで持ち掛けた
She approached him under the mask of love―under pretence of love.
仕掛け花火
a set―piece

content: 2. (=規模)a (large or small) scale

content.content: 米国は何事も大仕掛けだ
Everything is conducted on a large scale in America.
小さい仕掛けの博覧会だ
It is an exhibition on a small scale.
仕掛けばかり大きくて収益がいっこう挙がらない
The thing is conducted on a grand scale, but the profits are small.

しかけはなび〔仕掛け花火〕
〈名〉A set-piece

content:
しかける〔仕掛ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=着手する)to begin doing (anything); to go to work; to set to work; to set about (one's task); to take (a matter) in hand; to set one's hand to (some work); to put one's hand to the plough

content.content: 仕事を仕かける
to go to work―set about one's task―set one hand to the work
仕かけた仕事がある
I have some work in hand.
仕かけた仕事
work in hand
いったん仕かけたら止められぬ
Once you put your hand to the plough, you can not look back.

content: 2. (=装置する、設備する、据え付ける)to set up (a machine); to lay (a mine); to install (electric lights); to fit (a house or a ship with necessary appliances); to equip (a factory with machinery)

content.content: 機械を仕掛ける
to set up a machine―install an apparatus
織機{はた}を仕掛ける
to set up a loom
水雷を仕掛ける
to lay mines
船には無線電信が仕掛けてある
The ship is fitted with―equipped with―a wireless telegraphy apparatus.
あの工場には新式の機械が仕掛けてある
The factory is equipped with up―to―date machinery.
飯を仕掛ける
to prepare rice for boiling
飯は焚くばかりに仕掛けてある
The rice is ready for boiling.

content: 3. (=挑む)to challenge (one to a fight)

content.content: 決闘を仕かける
to challenge one to a duel―call out a man
けんかを仕かける
to pick a quarrel with one―fasten a quarrel on one
戦争を仕かける
to make war upon the enemy
恋を仕かける
to make love to a girl―make advances to a woman―pay court to a lady―court a lady
話しを仕かける
to accost a man―open conversation with a man

しかざん〔死火山〕
〈名〉An extinct volcano

content:
じがさん〔自画讃〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: じがじさん〔自画自讃〕

content:
しかし〔併し〕
〈接続詞〉But; however; nevertheless; and yet

content.content: しかしそれは本当か
But is that true?
こういうと変なようだがしかし本当だ
It may sound strange, and yet it is true for all that.
変なようだがしかし事実だ
It may seem strange, nevertheless it is a fact.
彼は金はずいぶん儲けたがしかしじきに使ってしまった
He made much money, which, however, he squandered very soon.
そうしかししかしと理屈を言うな
But me no buts!

じかし〔地貸し〕
〈名〉A landlord; a lessor

content:
しかじか〔云々〕
〈副〉
1. (=斯々)so and so:(=の) such and such

content.content: しかじかの次第であると述べた
I stated that such and such was the case.
しかじかの場合にはしかじかせよと言い付けた
I told him to do so and so on such and such an occasion.

content: 2. (=など)and so forth; and so on; and the like

content.content: 教授法しかじかの話があった
There was some talk about the method of teaching,and so on.

じがじさん〔自画自讃〕
〈名〉A eulogy on one's own painting; self-praise:(=する) to sing one's own praises; to blow one's own trumpet

しかして〔而して〕
〈接続詞〉And

content:
しかしながら〔併し乍ら〕
〈接続詞〉→『

content.content: しかし〔併し〕

じかしゅうよう〔自家修養〕
〈名〉Self-culture

content:
しかず〔如かず〕
〈叙述形容詞〉(It is)better, best

content.content: かかる場合には死するに如かず
On such occasions, it is better to die―it is best to die.
百聞一見に如かず
Seeing is better than hearing.
子を見ること親に如かず
The parent is the best judge of the child.
三十六計逃ぐるに如かず
“Discretion is the better part of valour.”
むしろ貧を楽しむに如かず
“Better be poor than wicked.”

content:
じかせん〔耳下腺〕
〈名〉The parotid gland

content.content: 耳下腺炎
parotitis―mumps

content:
しかた〔仕方〕
〈名〉
1. (=方法) a method (of doing something); a way (to do something)

content.content: なんとか仕方が無いものかね
Is there no way to do it?
そんな仕方では駄目だ
You can not do it (in) that way.
仕方を教えてくれ給え
Please show me how to do it.
彼は挨拶の仕方も知らない
He does not know how to greet you properly.
君はどんな仕方をするか
How do you go about it?
僕の仕方はこうだ
This is how I go about it.
それでは仕方が間違っている
You go about it in the wrong way―You go the wrong way about it.

content: 2. (=策)resource; remedy; help

content.content: なんとか仕方があるまいか
Is there no remedy?
どうか仕方があったろうに
You might have found some remedy for it.
どうも仕方が無い
There is no remedy―There is no resource―There is no help for it―It can not be helped.
他に仕方が無い
There is no other resource―There is no other way―There is no alternative.→『しかたがない〔仕方が無い〕』

content:
じかた〔地方〕
〈名〉The coast; the shore

content.content: 地方漁業
longshore fisheries

content:
しかたがない〔仕方が無い〕
〈熟語〉
1. (=詮方無し)one can not help it; it can not be helped; there is no help for it; there is no alternative; there is no remedy; it is not to be avoided; it is unavoidable; it is inevitable

content.content: 今となってはしかたがない
There is no help for it now―We can not recall the past.
待つよりほかにしかたがない
There is nothing for it but to wait―There is no alternative but to wait―We have no choice but to wait.
逃げるよりほかにしかたがない
There is nothing for it but to run―We must run for it.
一つ二つの間違いはしかたがない
A mistake or two can not be helped―One or two mistakes are not to be avoided.
若い時の失錯はしかたがない
A few slips in youth are not to be helped―not to be avoided―unavoidable.
君が勝手でしたことはしかたがないじゃないか
I can not help what you have done―How can I help what you have done?
鼻が高かろうと低かろうとうまれつきだからしかたがない
I can not help the shape of my nose.
大きな声は地声だからしかたがありません
I can not help my natural voice.
人に何と思われたってしかたがない
We can not help what others think of us.
こちらが悪いのだから何と言われてもしかたがない
We are in the wrong, We can not help whatever they may say―We must put up with anything they may say.
しかたがないと諦める
to abide by the inevitable―submit to necessity―bow to fate―resign oneself to fate―accept the situation―make the best of a bad bargain
犯人はしかたがないと諦めて神妙に縛に就いた
The culprit frankly accepted the situation, and suffered himself to be bound.

content: 2. (=已むを得ぬ)to be obliged to, be compelled to, be forced to, to constrained to (do something); to be under the necessity of (doing something)

content.content: 車が無いのでしかたがないから歩いて来た
As there was no ricksha to be had, I was obliged to walk it.
金を返さないのでしかたがないから訴えた
As he would not pay the money, I was obliged to―compelled to―forced to―go to law.
金が無いのでしかたがないから断った
As I had no money, I was obliged to refuse―under the necessity of refusing―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Want of money obliged me to refuse―laid me under the necessity of refusing.
約束したからしかたがない
My promise obliges me to do so―My promise lays me under the necessity of doing so―“A bargain is a bargain.”

content: 3. (=駄目だ)it is no use, it is no good (trying); there is no use in, there is no good in (trying)

content.content: 泣いたってしかたがない
It is no use crying―There is no use in crying―Crying will not help matters.
怒ったてしかたがない
It is no good getting angry―There is no good in getting angry―Anger will not mend matters.
いまさら何を言ったってしかたがない
It is no use talking now―There is no use in talking now―Talking will not help matters now.
いまさら悔いたってしかたがない
It is no good regretting―There is no good in regretting―Regrets will not mend matters―Do not indulge in vain regrets―Do not “cry over spilt milk.”
こんな地位にかじりついていたってしかたがない
It is no use sticking to such a position.

content: 4. (=たまらない)can not contain oneself

content.content: 腹が立ってしかたがない
I can not contain my anger.
そうしてみたくてしかたがない
I feel an irresistible impulse to do so.
水が飲みたくてしかたがない
I am dying for a drink of water.
これがどうしても本当のようでしかたがない
I feel that it is true.
僕にもできそうでしかたがない
I feel within me―feel it in my bones―that I can do it.
手が震えてしかたがない
My hands will shake.

content:
5. 
〈その他〉

content.content: してしまったことはしかたがない
I can not help what I have done―I can not undo what I have done―What I have done, I have done.
できたことはしかたがない
What is done, can not be helped―What is done, can not be undone―What is done, is done.
やってしまったものはしかたがない
What I have given, I have given.
書いてしまったものはしかたがない
What I have written, I have written―What is written, is written.
意見の差はしかたがない
Differences of opinion can not be helped―There will be differences of opinion.
けがはしかたがない
“Accidents will happen.”
子どものいたずらはしかがない
“Boys will be boys.”
若いからしかたがない
Young men will be young men―We must take his youth into account―We must make allowances for his youth.
西洋人だからしかたがない
We must make allowances (for his ignorance), seeing that he is a foreigner.
しかたがないから金を出した
I was obliged to give the money―I gave the money from necessity―Making a virtue of necessity, I gave the money.
武士はしかたがないから清貧を誇るのだ
Making a virtue of necessity, the samurai gloried in honourable poverty.
しかたがないから英語の先生を始めた
Having no other resource, I took to teaching English.
好い人が無いからしかたがないからあの男を使うのだ
I employ him for want of a better.
しかたがないからこんな家に住んでいるのだ
I live in such a house for want of a better.
しかたがないからこの地位で我慢しよう
I shall put up with this position for want of a better.
しかたがなければこの家で間に合う
This house will do in default of a better.
しかたがなけりゃこの家でも間に合う
This house will do at a pinch.
いよいよしかたが無けりゃ死ぬだけのことさ
When the worst comes to the worst, I can but die.
持って生まれた運だから善かれ悪しかれしかたがない
We must take our lot for better or for worse.
世の中はこんなものだから善かれ悪しかれしかたがない
We must take life for better or for worse.
(ピストルを向けられて)その論法で来るならしかたがない
If you use that logic, I must submit.
(彼も死んだが)命数だからしかたがない
His career was run―His race was run.
無い物はしかたがない
One can make nothing out of nothing.
(またやったか)子どもだからしかたがない
A child knows no better.
(ご不在か)しかたがない、また来よう
No matter! I will call again.
彼女は彼に急所を握られているからどうされてもしかたがない
He has a grip upon her, so she is at his mercy.
今度だけはしかたがないからこれから気をつけて下さい
I will overlook your fault for this time, but you will be more careful in future.
過ぎ去ったことはしかたがない
“Let bygones be bygones.”

content:
しかたばなし〔仕方話し〕
〈名〉Gesture; gesticulation; pantomime; a dumb show

content.content: 仕方話しをする
to make gestures―make a dumb show―pantomime

じがため〔地固め〕
〈名〉Groundwork, pile-driving:(=する) to solidify the foundation; to drive piles into the ground

content:
しかつ〔死活〕
〈名〉Life and death; existence; fate:(=の) death-or-life; vital; fatal

content.content: 家の死活に関する問題だ
The matter involves the existence of the family.
学校の死活に関する問題だ
The very life of the school is at stake.
国家の死活に関する戦争であった
The war was to decide the fate of the country―The very existence of the nation hung on the issue of the war―It was a death-or-life struggle.→『しかつもんだい〔死活問題〕』

content:
じかつ〔自活〕
〈名〉Self-support:(=する) to support oneself; to get one's own living; to shift for oneself; to fend for oneself; to provide for oneself

content.content: 孤児が自活のできるようになるまで僕が引取って世話をしよう
I will take charge of the orphan till he can shift for himself.
彼は(孤児で)子どもの時から自活している
He has been earning his own living from a child.
彼は自活することができるようになった
He has fallen into the way of getting his own living.
彼に自活の道を立ててやった
I have put him in the way of getting his own living.
自活の道を立てる
to put oneself in the way of getting one's own living
自活の道を講ずる
to seek for the means of supporting oneself

しがっかん〔視学官〕
〈名〉A school-inspector

しがっこう〔私学校〕
〈名〉A private school

content:
しかつめらしい〔鹿爪らしい〕
〈形〉Grave, solemn (face); formal (speech); consequential (air); prim (person); precise (dress); punctilious (manners); ceremonious (address, etc.)

content.content: 彼はしかつめらしい顔をしている
He looks grave―He has a solemn countenance.
しかつめらしい顔をしてそんなばかばかしいことを言っているからおかしい
He gravely says such absurd things.
あの人はしかつめらしいふうをしている
He has a consequential air―punctilious manners.
しかつめらしい身形{みなり}をしている
He is precisely dressed.
あのひとはしかつめらしい役人のようなふうをしている
He has the air of a prim official.
しかつめらしいお辞儀をする
They make a formal bow.

content:
しかつもんだい〔死活問題〕
〈名〉A matter of life and death; a death-or-life question; a question of vital importance; a vital question

content.content: これは死活問題だ
This is a death-or-life question―a hanging matter.
一家の死活問題だ
The matter involves the existence of the family.
学校の死活問題だ
The very life of the school is at stake.

content:
しかと〔確と〕
〈副〉
1. (=確かに)certainly; definitely; positively; for sure; for certain; for a certainty

content.content: 親父は今晩にも帰るかも知れませんがしかとはわかりません
Father may return this evening, but I can't say for certain―say positively.
しかとは存じません
I do not know for sure―know for certain―know for a certainty.
しかとわかっている
I know it for a certainty.
しかとは覚えません
I do not remember for certain.
しかとは受合われません
I can not be positive about it.
彼の行き先はしかとわからぬ
His destination is not definitely known.
しかとそうか
Are you certain of it?―Are you sure?
しかと申し付けたぞ
I charge you to see that it is done.

content: 2. (=明らかに)clearly; distinctly

content.content: しかとは見えぬ
I can not see distinctly.
しかとわかりました
I understand clearly what you mean.

content: 3. (=しっかり)firmly

content.content: しかと握る
to grasp firmly
しかと手を握った
I clasped his hand firmly―took a firm hold of his hand.

content:
じかどうちゃく〔自家撞着〕
〈名〉Self-contradiction:(=の) self-contradictory:(=する) to contradict oneself

content.content: 君の議論は自家撞着だ
Your argument is self-contradictory.

content:
しかない〔しか無い〕
〈副〉Only

content.content: これしか無い
I have only this―This is all I have.
生徒が五六十人しか無い
They have only fifty or sixty students―not more than fifty or sixty students.

content:
しがない〔性無い〕
〈形〉Poor; miserable; wretched; forlorn

content.content: しがない生活
a wretched life
しがないその日を送る
to lead a miserable existence
しがない身の上だ
She is in a forlorn condition.
こんなしがない人間でも曲ったことは致しません
Though poor, I am honest.

content:
じがね〔地金〕
〈名〉
1. (=土台の金)ground metal

content.content: メッキがはげて地金が出る
The gilt comes off, and the ground metal appears.

content: 2. (=本性)one's true character; metal

content.content: あの男は地金が好い
He is made of true metal.
地金を顕わす
to show one's true colours―betray the cloven hoof―throw off the mask

content:
しかねぬ〔仕兼ねぬ〕
〈他動〉To be capable of (anything); to make no scruple of, make no bones of, make nothing of (stealing); to stick at nothing

content.content: あれはどんな悪いことでもしかねない男だ
He is capable of anything―He will stick at nothing.
人殺しもしかねない
He will not stick at murder.
ゆすり騙りもしかねない奴だ
He will make no scruple of―make no bones of―make nothing of―blackmailing and swindling.

content:
しかねる〔仕兼ねる〕
〈他動〉Can not; to fail to (do anything)

content.content: 早速には返事をしかねます
I can not give you an immediate answer.
僕はその理を解しかねる
I fail to comprehend the reason.
僕は病気のため洋行しかねた
I could not go abroad on account of illness―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Illness prevented me from going abroad.

しかのみならず〔加之〕
〈副〉Besides; moreover; furthermore; and, what is more; and even

content:
しかばね〔屍〕
〈名〉A corpse; a dead body

content.content: 屍をさらす
to fail in battle―die on the battlefield
屍を鞭打つ
to speak ill of the dead

content:
しがみつく〔しがみ付く〕
〈他動〉To cling to (one)

content.content: 河で人を助けようと思ったら腕にしがみついて離れなかった
The drowning man clung fast to my arm.
女が男の頸玉にしがみついた
She locked her arms around his neck.
二人は互いにしがみついて離れぬ
They are locked in each other's arms.

content:
しかめづら〔顰め面〕
〈名〉A wry face; a grimace

content.content: しかめ面をする
to make a wry face―make a sour mouth―make a grimace

content:
しかめる〔顰める〕
〈自他動〉To grimace

content.content: 顔をしかめる
to make a wry face―make a sour mouth―make a grimace
彼は勉強を妨げられると顔をしかめる
He makes a wry face when he is disturbed in his studies.
彼は顔をしかめて薬を飲んだ
He swallowed the medicine with a sour mouth.
親父は百円払わせられて顔をしかめた
Father looked blue at having to pay a hundred yen.

content:
しかも〔而も〕
〈副〉
1. (=またその上に、おまけに)and that; and all this; and... too; and... as well; and... at that; and... into the bargain; and... to boot; even

content.content: 彼は及第した、しかも一番で
He has passed his examination, and that first on the list.
白昼しかも帝都の真中でかかる凶行のあらんとは物騒なわけだ
It is alarming that such a crime should be perpetrated in broad daylight, and that in the heart of the metropolis.
彼は英語で演説した、しかも下手な英語で
He spoke in English, and―in bad English, too―and in bad English at that.
家が売れた、しかも好い値にうれた
The house was sold, and sold, too, at a food price.
彼は黒ん坊だ、しかもきたない黒ん坊だ
He is a negro, and a dirty one, too―and a dirty one at that.
彼は貧乏でしかも病人と来ている
He is poor, and an invalid, into the bargain―and an invalid to boot.
彼は金を借り倒してしかも悪口まで言う奴だ
He bilked me, and abused me into the bargain.
彼は英語がよくできてしかも独語仏語も知っている
He is a good English scholar, and knows German and French as well.
彼は英語がうまい、しかも先生よりもうまい
He speaks English well―even better than his teacher.
その娘は器量が好い、しかも評判の姉よりも好い
She is pretty―even prettier than her famous sister.

content: 2. (=ちょうど)the very(と形容詞に訳す)

content.content: その家はしかもここにあったのだ
The house stood on this very spot.
汽車がしかもその瞬間に発車した
The train started at that very moment.
女が喉を突こうとするしかもその一刹那に戸が明いた
The door opened the very instant she was about to plunge the razor into her throat.
入って来た人があるから誰かと思えばしかも噂をしていた主人公じゃないか
Who should come in but the very man we were talking about?

content: 3. (=それにもかかわらず)and yet; for all that; with all that

content.content: 学問ができてもしかも教師に向かない人がある
A man may be a good scholar, and yet he may not make a good teacher.
あれほど金があってもしかも満足しない
For all his wealth, he is not contented.
彼は欠点多きもしかも偉人たるを失わぬ
With all his faults, he is a great man.

じかよう〔自家用〕
〈形〉(Articles) for household use; (articles) for home consumption

content:
しからざれば〔然らざれば〕
〈副〉If not; otherwise; else; or; or else

content.content: 彼は来ることあたわざりしならん、しからざれば必ず来たりしならん
He could not come, otherwise he must have come.
金を返せ、しからざれば訴える
Pay the money, else―or else―I will proceed against you.
忍耐せよ、しからざれば失敗せん
Persevere, or you will fail.

content:
しからしむる〔然らしむる〕
〈自動〉To cause it to be so; to make it so; to be due to (some cause)

content.content: 天候のしからしむる処だ
It is due to the weather.
それは彼の境遇のしからしむる処だ
It is due to his circumstances.
人情のしからしむる処
It is the dictates of nature―It is the promptings of the heart―It is human nature―Nature will assert herself.
運命のしからしむる処
It is the decree of Fate.
時勢のしからしむる処
It is the tendency of the times.

content:
しからず〔然らず〕
〈副〉Not so; otherwise

content.content: 我輩は然らず
Not so with me.
他は逃走せしが青年は然らず
The others ran away. Not so (with) the youth.
この場合は然らず
It is not so in this case―That is not the case here.
英語においては然らず
It is otherwise with English.
一見そう見えてもその実然らず
It may seem so at first sight, but, in point of fact, the reverse is the case.

content: 〈応答詞〉No

content.content: 大いに然らず
No, indeed!―A thousand times no!
決して然らず
No such thing!―Nothing of the kind!―Not a bit of it!―Far from it!
然らずと答える
to say no―reply in the negative

content:
しからずんば〔然らずんば〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: しからざれば〔然らざれば〕

content:
しからば〔然らば〕
〈副〉If so; than; and (then)

content.content: はたしてしからば由々しき大事である
If that be really the case, it is a matter of grave significance.
然らば行くことにしよう
Then I will go.
まず根本を極めよしからば枝葉は自ら明らかならん
First go to the root of the matter, and then the branches will become clear of themselves.
忍耐せよ、しからば成功せん
Persevere, and you will succeed.

しがらみ〔柵〕
〈名〉A hurdle; a wattle

しがらむ〔柵む〕
〈他動〉To wattle (together)

content:
しかり〔叱り〕
〈名〉A scolding

content.content: お叱りを蒙る
to get a scolding―catch it

content:
しかり〔然り〕
〈副〉So

content.content: 語学研究もまた然り
So it is with language study.
英語研究においては殊に然りとす
That is especially the case with the study of English.
この場合においても然り
That is the case―Such is the case―here.
はたして然り
It is as I thought―as I expected.

content: 〈応答詞〉Yes; ay

content.content: 大いに然り
Yes, indeed!―A thousand time yes!
正に然り
Even so―Exactly.
然りと答える
to say yes―reply in the affirmative

じかり〔地借り〕
〈名〉A tenant; a lessee

しかりつける〔叱り付ける〕
〈他動〉To give (one) a good scolding; to give (one) a severe rating

しかりとばす〔叱り飛ばす〕
〈他動〉To storm at(one); to swear at(one); to rate at(one); to let fly at(one)

content:
しかる〔叱る〕
〈他動〉To scold, reprove, reprimand, chide, rebuke, lecture, rate, row (one for a fault); to give (one) a scolding; to give (one) a rating; to give (one) a rap on the knuckles; to read (one) a lecture; to take (one) to task; to bring (one) to book

content.content: うんと叱ってやった
I gave him a good scolding―gave him a severe rating.
うんと叱られた
I got a good scolding―got a severe rating.
叱られる
to be scolded―be reproved―get a scolding―get it―catch it―get into trouble―get into a row
怠けて先生に叱られた
I was reproved by my teacher for my idleness―My teacher reproved me for my idleness.
そんなことすると叱られるぞ
If you do such a thing, you will catch it.
お父さんに叱られるぞ
You will have your father reprove you.
そんなことすると叱られます
If I do such a thing, I shall get into trouble―get into a row.
道具にいたずらすると職人に叱られるぞ
If you meddle with the tools, you will get into trouble with the workmen.
子どもは今日は叱られて小さくなっている
The child is in trouble today.
お前はどうして叱られたか
How did you get scolded?―How did you get into trouble?

content:
しかるに〔然るに〕
〈接続詞〉While; but; so

content.content: 世間では彼を英文家だといっている、しかるにそれに反して彼は英文などはまるで書いたことが無い
People call him an English writer; while, on the contrary, he never penned a line of English.
彼は無口な人だ、しかるに細君は非常におしゃべりだ
He is a man of few words, while his wife is a great chatterbox.
彼は金持ちだと思っておった、しかるに彼が死んでみたらば一文無しであったそうだ
I supposed him to be rich, but, at his death, he was found to be penniless.
彼は有名な勉強家だ、しかるに彼が失敗したのは意外だ
He is noted for his diligence, so it is strange that he should have failed.

content:
しかるのち〔然る後〕
〈副〉And then; afterward

content.content: まず考えてしかる後に言え
First think, and then speak.
まず働いてしかる後に遊ぶ
Business first and pleasure afterwards.

content:
しかるべき〔然る可き〕
〈形〉Due (honour); fit (person) proper (conduct); suitable (position, etc.)

content.content: しかるべき礼をもって彼を遇した
We treated him with due honour―did him due honour.
しかるべき人物があったらお知らせ下さい
If you hear of a fit person,―a proper person,―a fit and proper person,―you will please let me know.
しかるべき地位があったらお世話しましょう
If I come across a suitable position, I will procure it for you.
我々は悦んでしかるべきだ
It is proper that we should rejoice―We ought to rejoice―We have cause for joy.
一言の挨拶くらいはあってもしかるべきだ
It is proper that he should apologize―He ought to apologize.

content:
しかるべく〔然る可く〕
〈副〉Properly; rightly; as one thinks fit; at one's discretion

content.content: しかるべくご処置を願います
You may do as you think fit―You may act at your discretion.
万事しかるべくお願い申します
I leave everything to your judgment.
しかるべく取計いましょう
I will set matters right.
主人の方をしかるべくお執成し下さい
Please set me right with my master!

しかれども〔雖然〕
〈接続詞〉But; and yet; however; nevertheless

content:
しかれる〔轢かれる〕
〈受動〉→『

content.content: ひかれる〔轢かれる〕

しかん〔仕官〕
〈名〉Government service:(=する) to enter government service; to take office

content:
しかん〔士官〕
〈名〉An officer:(陸軍にては)a company officer:(海軍にては)a lieutenant

content.content: 士官学校
the Military Academy
士官候補生
a military cadet
(軍艦の)士官室
the ward―room

content:
しかん〔私函〕
〈名〉A post-office box (a P. O. box―と略す)

content.content: 東京私函三十号宛
Let the letter be addressed to P. O. box No 30, Tokyo.

しかん〔視官〕
〈名〉The organ of sight

しかん〔歯冠〕
〈名〉The crown of a tooth

content:
しがん〔志願〕
〈名〉
1. (=出願)application:(=する) to apply (for entrance); to volunteer(for military service); to volunteer one's services (as interpreter); to offer one's services (as teacher); to offer oneself (as English teacher); to come forward

content.content: 入学を志願する
to apply for entrance
入学志願者
an applicant for entrance―a candidate for admission
志願者は千人以上ある
The applicants number over a thousand.
志願書を差出す
to send in an application
兵役を志願する
to volunteer for military service
志願服役
voluntary service
英国の陸軍は志願制度ある
The service in the British army is voluntary.
志願兵
a volunteer
通訳官を志願する
to volunteer one's services as interpreter―offer oneself as interpreter
英語教員を志願した
I offered myself as teacher of English.
有志を募っても志願して出る者が無かった
Volunteers were called for, but none came forward.

content: 2. (=志望)desire; aspiration:(=する) to wish; to desire; to aspire to (some honours)

content.content: 彼は外交官志願でいまフランス語をやっている
He wishes to be a diplomat,―aspires to diplomatic honours,―and is studying French.
僕は軍人志願だ
I wish to be a soldier―I aspire to military honours―I am an aspirant to military honours.

content:
じかん〔時間〕
〈名〉
1. (=時)time

content.content: もう学校へ行く時間だ
It is time to go to school.
もう寝る時間だ
It is time to go to bed.
もう時間ですよ
The time is up―Time!
時間がかかる
to take time
時間を費す
to spend time
時間をつぶす
to waste time
時間を消す
to while away the time―kill time
時間に間に合ったか
Were you in time?
時間に後れた
I was behind time―I was late.
時間を守る
to be punctual
時間を厳守する
to be punctual to the minute
あの人はいつも時間通りに来る、時間を誤まらぬ
He is always on time.
この汽車はいつも時間通りに発着する
The train is always on schedule time.
時間表
a time-table―a schedule
時間が経つ
Time passes―Time elapses―Time goes on―Time goes by―Time flies.
面白く遊んでいると時間の経つのが早い
Pleasure makes time fly.
(忙しくて)時間の経つのを知らずにいた
I took no note of time.
時間を利用する
to make the most of one's time
時間の経済を図る
to be economical of time
時間の経済
economy of time

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: まだ時間が早い
It is still early.
時間が早過ぎた
I am too early.
もう時間が遅い
It is late―It is too late.
船は予定の時間より早く着いた
We have arrived sooner than we expected.
時間を利用せよ、時間を重んぜよ(一寸の光陰軽んずべからず)
Improve every moment!

content: 2. (=何時間の時間)an hour

content.content: 一時間、二時間、三時間
(for) one hour―(for) two hours―(for) three hours
二時間待った
I have been waiting for two hours.
何時間
How many hours?―How long?
仙台へ行くのに何時間かかるか
How long does it take to go to Sendai?
何時間も何時間も続けてしゃべりづめだ
He keeps talking for hours together.
五時間続けて(ひと息に)働く
I work for five hours at a stretch.
二十四時間ぶっ通し(ひと息に)寝た
I slept for twenty-four hours at a stretch.
時間で貸す借馬がある
Horses can be hired by the hour.
営業時間
business hours
執務時間
office hours
(医者の)診察時間
office hours
休憩時間
recess

content: 3. (=学校の時間)an hour; a period; a lesson; a class

content.content: 始めの時間は英語だ
We have English in the first hour―in the first period.
二時間目は数学だ
We have mathematics in the second hour.
今は何時間目ですか
Which hour is it now?
今日は英語の時間が無い
We have no English lesson today.
今日は体操の時間を休んだ
I cut the gymnastics class today.
時間がふさがっている
The hour is close―I am engaged for the hour.
時間をふさぐ
to fill the hour―stop the gap
時間ふさぎ
a stop-gap
僕は時間を背負っている
I have many hours to teach.
時間を減らしてもらいたい
I wish to have my hours lessened―be eased of some hours.
時間を増やす
to increase the hours
時間を繰上げる
to move up the hours
あの学校では時間で給料を払う
That school pays the teachers by the hour―The teachers of that school are paid by the hour.
時間給
payment by the hour
授業時間
school hours
放課時間
recess
時間の繰合い
hour-arrangement
時間表
a schedule

content:
じかん〔次官〕
〈名〉A vice-minister

content.content: 外務次官
the Vice-Minister for Foreign Affairs

しかんがっこう〔士官学校〕
〈名〉The Military Academy

content:
じかんきゅう〔時間給〕
〈名〉Payment by the hour

content.content: あの学校は時間給だ
That school pays the teachers by the hour―The teachers of that school are paid by the hour.

content:
しがんしゃ〔志願者〕
〈名〉An applicant (for entrance); a candidate (for admission); a volunteer (for some service)

content.content: 入学志願者は千人以上ある
The applicants for entrance number over as thousand.
志願者を募る
to call for volunteers
志願者無し
None came forward.

じかんひょう〔時間表〕
〈名〉A time-table; a schedule

じかんふさぎ〔時間塞ぎ〕
〈名〉A stop-gap

content:
しがんへい〔志願兵〕
〈名〉A volunteer

content.content: 志願兵になる
to enlist as a volunteer
志願兵は一年間服役する
A volunteer serves for a year.
一年志願兵
a one-year volunteer
志願兵は費用は自弁だ
A volunteer must pay his own expenses.
中学卒業生は志願兵となる特典あり
Those who have finished the middle school enjoy the privilege of enlisting as volunteers.

じかんわり〔時間割〕
〈名〉A schedule

content:
しき〔四季〕
〈名〉The four seasons

content.content: 四季の中で春と秋とどちらが好いか
Which is the best of all seasons, spring or autumn?
四季を通じて店は繁昌だ
The house flourishes at all seasons―all the year round.
風景絶佳四季の眺めに富む
The scenery is superb, and each season presents its own beauty.
四季咲きの花
a perennial flower
四季咲きの薔薇
a remontant
(西洋の)四季払い
quarterly payment
四季の勘定日
quarter-days

content:
しき〔士気〕
〈名〉Martial spirit; morale

content.content: 士気振るう
The martial spirit of the men is high―The morale of the troops is excellent.
我が軍の士気大いに振るう
The martial spirit of the army has greatly risen―The morale of the army is perfect―The army is in great form.
士気振わず
The martial spirit is low―The morale is low.
第一戦の勝敗は士気に関する
The issue of the first battle affects the morale of the troops.
士気を鼓舞する
to raise the morale of the men―inspire the men with martial spirit
士気沮喪
demoralization
士気沮喪する
to become demoralized
軍隊は士気沮喪している
The troops are demoralized.
この一敗で軍隊は士気を沮喪した
The defeat demoralized the troops―The defeat had a demoralizing effect on the troops―The defeat shook the morale of the troops.
全校士気沮喪している
The whole school is down-hearted―low-spirited.

content:
しき〔志気〕
〈名〉Spirit; sentiment

content.content: 愛国の志気を養う
to foster the spirit of patriotism
彼は愛国の志気に富んでいる
He is patriotic―full of patriotic spirit.
青年の志気を鼓舞する
to inspire youth with lofty sentiments

content:
しき〔指揮〕
〈名〉Command; orders; directions:(=する) to command (an army); to order, direct (the men to do something)

content.content: 大将は軍を指揮する
A general commands an army.
大佐は連隊を指揮する
A colonel commands a regiment.
大尉は中隊を指揮する
A captain commands a company.
指揮官
a commander―a commandant―the officer in command
貴方が指揮官ですか
Are you in command?
軍の指揮官となる
to take command of an army
彼は軍の指揮官だ
He is in command of the army.
軍を指揮する大将
the general in command of the army―the general at the head of the army
大将の指揮する軍
the army under the command of the general
大山大将は全軍の指揮を委ねられた
Gen. Oyama was placed in command of the whole army―The whole army was placed under the command of Gen. Oyama.
少佐は一隊を指揮して敵に向かった
The major went against the army at the head of a body of troops.
大将自ら行動を指揮した
The general directed the operations in person.
兵を指揮して塹壕を掘らせた
He ordered his men to dig a trench.
彼は万事を指揮している
He has everything under his orders.
僕も彼の指揮を仰いでいる
I work under his orders―I work under him.

content:
しき〔死期〕
〈名〉The time of death; the hour of death

content.content: 人は死期を悟るものか
Does man know his hour of death?
彼は死期が迫っている
He is dying―He is at death's door―He lies at the point of death―His moments are numbered―His end is near.
商売で失敗したので死期を早めた
Failure in business hastened his death.

content:
しき〔式〕
〈名〉
1. (=儀式)a ceremony; a function:(宗教上のは)a rite; a service

content.content: 式を挙げる、式を行う
to hold a ceremony―perform a ceremony―conduct a function
式は最も厳粛に行われた
The function was conducted with the greatest solemnity.
葬式
funeral rites―burial service
仏式の葬儀
a funeral with Buddhistic rites
卒業式
the graduation ceremony
開業式、開通式、開校式
the opening ceremony―the inauguration

content: 2. (=形式)a form

content.content: 式の如く、式の通り
according to form―in due form
願書は式の如く書きました
The application is drawn up in due form―properly drawn up.
書式
form (of writing)
第二号書式
Form No.

content: 23. (=方式)a method; a system

content.content: 西洋式の教育
the foreign method of education
正則式の英語教授法
the Seisoku system of teaching English

content: 4. (=型)a type; a style; a plan; a fashion

content.content: 新式の砲
a new-type gun
有阪式
the Arisaka type
Macaulay 式の文章を書く人が多い
Many people write in the style of Macaulay―? la Macaulay.
西洋式の旅館
a hotel in foreign style―on the foreign plan
あの西洋人は日本式の顔をしている
He has a face of the Japanese style.
なんでも軍艦式にやる
He does everything warship-fashion.
本は斎藤式にできている
The book is written Saito-fashion.

content:
5. (=運算)operation
6. (=物理、化学の式)a formula
7. (=論理の式)a mood
8. (=数学の式)an expression

content.content: 代数式
an algebraic expression

content:
しき〔敷〕
〈名〉A stand

content.content: 釜敷き
a boiler-stand
